analyzed: bla ma dang 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /

analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum dang / lha'i tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa la 'di lta ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i blo gros dang / blo gros thams cad ba dang / blo gros 'phel ba dang / 'jig rten gsum rnam par gnon pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: the bodhisattva Vimalamati, the bodhisattva Acintyamati, the bodhisattva Sarvamati, the bodhisattva Vardhamānamati, the bodhisattva Trilokavijayamatī,

original: @111b nam mkha'i mdzod dang / kun tu bzang po dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sred med kyi bu dang / mi thub sel dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang /

analyzed: de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bcu drug dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la 'di lta ste /

original: rab 'byor dang / ka tya'i bu dang / 'od srung dang / lteng rgyas 'od srung dang / mood gal gyi bu dang / mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / glang po'i mchod rten dang / sh'a ra dva ti'i bu dang / de dag la sogs pa nyan thos stong phrag nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bcom ldan 'das la yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te bzhugs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor dang / ka tya'i bu dang / 'od srung dang / lteng rgyas 'od srung dang / mood gal gyi bu dang / mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / glang po'i mchod rten dang / sh'a ra dva ti'i bu dang / de dag la sogs pa nyan thos stong phrag nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis bcom ldan 'das la yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te bzhugs so //
translated: Subhūti, Kātyāyana, Kāśyapa, Urubilvā Kāśyapa, Maudgalyāyana, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Gavāṃpati, Śāradvatīputra, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / ci'i skyes bu dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyang 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang du chos nyan pa'i phyir lhags so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / ci'i skyes bu dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyang 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang du chos nyan pa'i phyir lhags so //
translated: Moreover, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, and others had also come to that assembly to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor der byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor der byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros la bka' stsal pa /

original: dri ma med pa'i blo gros /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i blo gros /

original: khyod kyis shar gyi phyogs kyi snang ba chen po 'di mthong ngam /
analyzed: khyod kyis shar gyi phyogs kyi snang ba chen po 'di mthong ngam /

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs @112a *//
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs @112a *//
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vimaladatta rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

analyzed: te bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos mngon par btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Bowing his head at the feet of the Blessed One, he said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mthong lags so //
analyzed: mthong lags so //

original: shar phyogs kyi ngos kyi snang ba shin tu chen po yongs su 'phro ba 'di 'tshal lags na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi ngos kyi snang ba shin tu chen po yongs su 'phro ba 'di 'tshal lags na /
translated: I see this great light shining in the east.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta bu'i snang ba 'di ci lags /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i snang ba 'di ci lags /

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros kyis slar yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: 'od chen po 'di sus bgyis pa bka' stsal du gsol //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis cung zad bzhad pa dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

original: dri ma med pa'i blo gros //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i blo gros //

analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' lag na rdo rje dga' ba dang tshim pas rang gi rig pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing //

original: gzhan yang lha ma yin dang / srin po dang / sha za dang / 'byung bo stong phrag rnams kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir 'ong bar 'dod pa'i snang ba yin no //

analyzed: phyin nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //

analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

translated: if you wish to say something in my presence, you should understand that a bodhisattva mahāsattva who strives for the benefit of all beings is certainly wise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lag na rdo rjes slar yang bcom ldan 'das la bltas nas de nas yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la rnam par bltas nas ngo phab ste cang mi smra bar 'khod par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lag na rdo rjes slar yang bcom ldan 'das la bltas nas de nas yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la rnam par bltas nas ngo phab ste cang mi smra bar 'khod par gyur to //
translated: When the Blessed One said this, the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi looked again at the Blessed One, then looked at the entire assembly of retinues, and sat there with his face down, saying nothing.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag na rdo rje cang mi smra bar 'khod par gzigs nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

original: rig pa'i rgyal po dpag tu med pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po /
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po dpag tu med pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po /

analyzed: 'khor thams cad spro ba'i sems su gyur pas cang mi smra bar 'khod kyi /
translated: the entire retinue has become inspired and is seated in silence.

original: smros shig smros shig /
analyzed: smros shig smros shig /
translated: Speak, speak!

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa /

original: lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Vajrapāṇi said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang @113a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang @113a *//

translated: I will call out to the asura lord named Pāpīyān, surrounded by a great retinue of asuras, and return to my own abode. Blessed One,

analyzed: gnas der bdag gis sngon ma 'tshal ba'i khang pa dang / sgo dang / rta babs dang / yang thog dang / phyir dang / mtsho dang / mte'u dang / rdzing dang / khron pa dang / sgo dang / sgo gseng rnams mthong lags so //
translated: I saw there houses, doors, archways, upper chambers, courtyards, lakes, ponds, pools, wells, doors, and windows that I had never seen before.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gang gis kyang sngon ma 'tshal te /
analyzed: bdag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gang gis kyang sngon ma 'tshal te /

analyzed: bdag gis de'i rnam par rnal 'byor bas bsam gtan mchog la mnyam par bzhag lags so //
translated: I settled into the highest meditative absorption that I had ever known.

analyzed: der lha ma yin gyi dbang po gzhan len gyis bdag la bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then the lord of the asuras, Samvara, said to me, “Blessed One,

analyzed: gzhal du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang stobs dang rnam par rol pas nam mkha' khyab pa'i sku mnga' ba /
translated: you have a body that pervades the sky with its inconceivable and immeasurable magical power, strength, and display.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ci'i phyir bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog par gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ci'i phyir bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog par gyur /
translated: Why is the great bodhisattva who has conquered the three worlds now resting in meditative absorption?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis gnas khang na nyams mi dga' ba cung zad kyang ma mchis na /
analyzed: bdag gis gnas khang na nyams mi dga' ba cung zad kyang ma mchis na /
translated: I do not see the slightest bit of discomfort in my dwelling.

analyzed: gang gi don du bsam gtan mnyam par 'jog pa lags par bka' stsal du gsol zhes mchi'o //
translated: Please tell me for what purpose I should enter into meditative concentration.”

original: de nas lha ma yin gyi dbang po des sgyu ma thams cad @113b dang / 'khrul 'khor dang / sgo glegs la sogs pa gleng lags so //
analyzed: de nas lha ma yin gyi dbang po des sgyu ma thams cad @113b dang / 'khrul 'khor dang / sgo glegs la sogs pa gleng lags so //
translated: Then the lord of the asuras spoke of all illusions, machines, doors, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis de zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir snang ba chen po 'dzin pa'i rdo rje khro bo chen po rdo rjes 'og ces bgyi ba 'khrul 'khor thams cad kyi bla ma'i bla mar gyur ba /
analyzed: bdag gis de zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir snang ba chen po 'dzin pa'i rdo rje khro bo chen po rdo rjes 'og ces bgyi ba 'khrul 'khor thams cad kyi bla ma'i bla mar gyur ba /
translated: in order to subdue him, I explained the great vajra wrath that holds the great light, the supreme of all machines,

original: 'khrul 'khor brgya rtsa brgyad po thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor brgya rtsa brgyad po thams cad 'joms par byed pa /

original: nye bar zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed pa /
translated: pacifies them,

original: ltung bar byed pa /
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa /
translated: causes them to fall,

original: nges par 'joms par bshad lags so //
analyzed: nges par 'joms par bshad lags so //
translated: and definitely destroys them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di rjes su mkhyen no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di rjes su mkhyen no //
translated: The Blessed One knows this.

original: bdag gis dga' ba'i bzhin gyis bshad pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya tha ma la sems can skyabs med pa rnams zhi ba dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'khrul 'khor brgya rtsa brgyad po thams cad 'joms pa'i rdo rje sa 'og ces bya ba 'khral 'khor thams cad kyi bla ma'i bla ma bdag gis bshad par bgyi'o //

translated: I will explain with a joyful countenance, for the benefit and happiness of many beings, O Blessed One, in the future, in the final five hundred years, for those beings without refuge, for the sake of peace, and for the complete perfection of the perfection of generosity, I will explain the Vajra Underground, which conquers all one hundred and eight machines, the supreme of all machines, called the Vajra Underground.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to Vajrapāṇi:

original: lag na rdo rjes gsol pa /
analyzed: lag na rdo rjes gsol pa /
translated: Vajrapāṇi said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: brjod pa 'di bsgrub par dka' ba ma lags kyi /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di bsgrub par dka' ba ma lags kyi /
translated: this statement is not difficult to accomplish.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba mdzad du gsol / bde bar gshegs pas rjes su gnang @114a *//
translated: May the Blessed One please grant permission.

original: ba mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: ba mdzad du gsol //
translated: May the Sugata please grant permission.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: bdag gis bsgrub par dka' ba brjod par mi bgyi'o //
translated: I will not speak of what is difficult to accomplish.

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po gzhan len gyi 'khrul 'khor bde blag tu sgrub par byed pa de dag gis rjes su dran te bshad par bgyi lags na /
translated: I will recall and explain the yantras of the asura lords that are easily accomplished.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bdag la rjes su gnang ba mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Vajrapāṇi,

original: ngas rjes su gnang gi /
analyzed: ngas rjes su gnang gi /
translated: “I grant you permission.

original: khyod kyis rjes su shod cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis rjes su shod cig /
translated: You may explain it.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / thabs la mkhas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gsang ba chen po ston cig /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / thabs la mkhas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gsang ba chen po ston cig /
translated: For the sake of benefiting many beings, for the sake of happiness for many beings, and for the sake of perfecting the perfection of generosity through skillful means, please teach the great secret of the machine master with concepts.

original: de nas lag na rdo rje bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang nas ca co'i sgra yang dang yang du phyung nas rdo rje gyen du gsor zhing rdo rje 'bar ba'i phreng ba can zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te rdo rje sa 'og
analyzed: de nas lag na rdo rje bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang nas ca co'i sgra yang dang yang du phyung nas rdo rje gyen du gsor zhing rdo rje 'bar ba'i phreng ba can zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te rdo rje sa 'og
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, with the permission of the Blessed One, repeatedly made a clamorous sound, brandished the vajra upwards, and entered the meditative absorption called the garland of blazing vajras.

original: gi gsang sngags smras pa /
analyzed: gi gsang sngags smras pa /
translated: He then spoke the mantra of the vajra underworld:

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Namo ratnatrayāya |

original: na ma shtsanda badzra p'a na ye /
analyzed: na ma shtsanda badzra p'a na ye /
translated: Namaḥ ścaṇḍavajrapāṇaye |

original: ma h'a yakasha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: ma h'a yakasha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: Mahāyakṣasenāpataye |

original: aom hr'i: po tri badzra p'a t'a la h'a n'a ma th'a badnydza p'a ta ya m'a tsi ra ma badzra kro dha h'um phat/
analyzed: aom hr'i: po tri badzra p'a t'a la h'a n'a ma th'a badnydza p'a ta ya m'a tsi ra ma badzra kro dha h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ hṛīḥ pota vajrapāṭalena māthāvadana pātaya mā carama vajrakrodha hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas rdo rje khro bo chen pos kun 'od zer gyis snang bar byas te sa chen po 'di rnam pa drug tu @114b g-yos so //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje khro bo chen pos kun 'od zer gyis snang bar byas te sa chen po 'di rnam pa drug tu @114b g-yos so //
translated: Then the great wrathful vajra illuminated all with light rays and this great earth shook in six ways.

original: lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo rnams rdo rje khro bos gzir bas skyabs med par gyur te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo rnams rdo rje khro bos gzir bas skyabs med par gyur te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: The asuras and asura maidens, oppressed by the wrathful vajra, became without refuge and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: dong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas 'di skad ces smra zhing 'dud par byed do //
analyzed: dong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas 'di skad ces smra zhing 'dud par byed do //
translated: Having gone, they bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One and, bowing down, said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag srung du gsol //
analyzed: bdag srung du gsol //
translated: please protect us!

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: yongs su bskyang du gsol //
analyzed: yongs su bskyang du gsol //
translated: please care for us!

original: rdo rje khro bos bdag cag yongs su gzir to //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bos bdag cag yongs su gzir to //
translated: The wrathful vajra oppresses us.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rdo rje khro bo 'di bshad pas bdag cag gi khang pa rnams kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams med par gyur /
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo 'di bshad pas bdag cag gi khang pa rnams kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams med par gyur /
translated: by this explanation of the wrathful vajra, our machines in the palaces have disappeared,

original: sgo gtan rnams med par gyur; sgo rnams grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: sgo gtan rnams med par gyur; sgo rnams grol bar gyur to //
translated: our door bolts have disappeared, and our doors have opened.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ma byung ba'i sems can rnams kyang byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i sems can rnams kyang byung bar gyur to //
translated: and those sentient beings who had not yet appeared came into existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'dir ji ltar gnas par bgyi bka' stsal du gsol; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar gnas par bgyi bka' stsal du gsol; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: please tell us how we should abide here.” The Blessed One said,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: ma 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig /
analyzed: ma 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig /
translated: do not be afraid, do not be afraid!

original: lag na rdo rje'i dam tshig la mnos shig /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i dam tshig la mnos shig /
translated: Take up the samaya of Vajrapāṇi.

original: de lta na bde ba la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bde ba la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way you will abide in bliss.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lag na rdo rje la gzigs te 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lag na rdo rje la gzigs te 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One looked at Vajrapāṇi and said this:

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: “Vajrapāṇi,

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa rmad du byung ba'i dam tshig ston la bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa rmad du byung ba'i dam tshig ston la bde bar gyis shig /
translated: teach the samaya of the lords of the asuras and so forth. Be at ease.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / phyag na rdo rjes lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin gyi chung ma dag la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / phyag na rdo rjes lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin gyi chung ma dag la bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Vajrapāṇi said to the asuras and the asura women,

original: 'dir thog @115a *//
analyzed: 'dir thog @115a *//
translated: “Here, take up the samaya of Vajrapāṇi.

original: mar rdo rje sa 'og gi khro bo chen po'i sa 'og gi dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig la gang 'jug pa de dag 'dir 'khrul 'khor chen po'i bla ma'i rtsi sman dang / phye ma dang / rtsa ba dang / sbyar sman dang / grub pa'i rdzas dang /
analyzed: mar rdo rje sa 'og gi khro bo chen po'i sa 'og gi dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig la gang 'jug pa de dag 'dir 'khrul 'khor chen po'i bla ma'i rtsi sman dang / phye ma dang / rtsa ba dang / sbyar sman dang / grub pa'i rdzas dang /
translated: Those who enter the commitments of the maṇḍala of the great wrathful one of the underworld, the vajra underworld, will here obtain the elixir of the guru of the great machine, the powder, the root, the compounded medicine, the substances of accomplishment,

original: dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / gzhon nu ma dang / lha ma yin gyi bu ga dang / sgor 'jug pa dang / 'khrul 'khor thams cad 'joms pa dang / skem par byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / gzhon nu ma dang / lha ma yin gyi bu ga dang / sgor 'jug pa dang / 'khrul 'khor thams cad 'joms pa dang / skem par byed pa de dag ni /
translated: the mercury, the elixir, the maiden, the womb of the demigod son, the entrance to the door, the destruction of all machines, and the emaciation.

original: 'jug ngogs bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug ngogs bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have an easy passage.

original: gzhan du na de dag 'grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir sa 'og gi dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na de dag 'grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir sa 'og gi dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, they will not be accomplished. Therefore, enter the maṇḍala of the underworld.

original: lha ma yin rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: To the demigods he said, You should enter the maṇḍala of the underworld.

original: bu gar 'jug nus pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud kyi khams dang / gser 'gyur dang / dug sman dang / sa 'og dang / zhing gi dngos grub dag rang nyid kyi khang par 'jug pa ltar rdo rje'i bye brag gis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu gar 'jug nus pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud kyi khams dang / gser 'gyur dang / dug sman dang / sa 'og dang / zhing gi dngos grub dag rang nyid kyi khang par 'jug pa ltar rdo rje'i bye brag gis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The powers of the Action Tantra are the ability to enter into the body of another, the ability to transform base metals into gold, the ability to transform poison into medicine, the ability to travel underground, and the ability to enter one's own house.🔽

original: zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I declare that the accomplishments of the alchemical powers, the elixir, the medicine, the underworld, and the field will be achieved by the distinctions of the vajra, just like entering one's own house.

original: gzhan du na skyil 'khor ma mthong na nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na skyil 'khor ma mthong na nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the maṇḍala is not seen, there will be failure.

original: rdo rje khro bo'i rgyal po chen po 'di'i rang nyid kyi rtog pa dang / rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bya ba mi bya la /
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo'i rgyal po chen po 'di'i rang nyid kyi rtog pa dang / rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bya ba mi bya la /
translated: One should not perform the various activities of the means of accomplishment taught in other tantras of this Great Wrathful King of Vajra, but should accomplish it by the means taught in this very tantra.

original: rtog pa gzhan gyi cho ga 'dod pas bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan gyi cho ga 'dod pas bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not accomplish it by desiring the means taught in other tantras.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po dga' zhing rangs te rab tu tshim pa dang / mgu ba skyes nas @115b rang nyid kyis phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor mthong nas nges par 'byung bar byas te bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi bran du gyur to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po dga' zhing rangs te rab tu tshim pa dang / mgu ba skyes nas @115b rang nyid kyis phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor mthong nas nges par 'byung bar byas te bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi bran du gyur to //
translated: Having said this, the asuras and asura lords, delighted, overjoyed, and extremely satisfied and pleased, having seen the maṇḍala of Vajrapāṇi themselves, were liberated and became the servants of all the blessed ones.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes lha'i mig gis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par bltas nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes lha'i mig gis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par bltas nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the blessed one, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi, having looked with the divine eye at the maṇḍala assembly, declared the maṇḍala of the sacred pledge:

original: grong ngam grong khyer gyi sa'i phyogs legs par brtags nas dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te rdo dang / gseg ma dang / rus pa dor nas rgyu skar dge ba la rjes su mthun pa'i tshon rtsi lnga'i phye mas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi ba /
analyzed: grong ngam grong khyer gyi sa'i phyogs legs par brtags nas dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te rdo dang / gseg ma dang / rus pa dor nas rgyu skar dge ba la rjes su mthun pa'i tshon rtsi lnga'i phye mas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi ba /
translated: “Having examined a site in a village or town, having begun from the northeast, having removed stones, pebbles, and bones, on an auspicious lunar day, with the five-colored chalk powder that is in accordance with the rite, one should draw a square maṇḍala

original: khru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa drug pa can yang dag par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa drug pa can yang dag par bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw a four-cubit [maṇḍala] with four doors and six corners.

original: sgo dang sgo'i mtshams rnams su rdo rje dang yungs kar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo dang sgo'i mtshams rnams su rdo rje dang yungs kar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place a vajra and white mustard seeds at the door and door-posts.

original: shar phyogs kyi char sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi char sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the eastern quarter one should draw the Blessed Buddha.

original: byang du 'jig rten dbang phyug /
analyzed: byang du 'jig rten dbang phyug /
translated: In the north, Lokeśvara.

original: lhor rdo rje 'chang /
analyzed: lhor rdo rje 'chang /
translated: In the south, Vajradhara.

original: nub tu chung ma dang bcas pa'i khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan can no //
analyzed: nub tu chung ma dang bcas pa'i khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan can no //
translated: In the west, the one with the banner of the best of bulls together with his wife.

original: dbar ldan du dri ma med pa'i blo gros lag par rnga yab 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dbar ldan du dri ma med pa'i blo gros lag par rnga yab 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the northeast, Vimaladatta holding a yak-tail fan in his hand.

original: mer snying po'o //🔽lus ngan du rjes su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mer snying po'o // lus ngan du rjes su spyod pa'o //
translated: In the southeast, Garbha.🔽In the southwest, Anuyāyin.

original: rlung du las thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: rlung du las thams cad pa'o //
translated: In the northwest, Sarvakarmāntakṛt.

original: dbus su rdo rje sa 'og lag par rdo rje dang dgra sta 'dzin pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje sa 'og lag par rdo rje dang dgra sta 'dzin pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle, Vajrapātāla holding a vajra and a battle-axe in his hand should be drawn.

original: snying po dang rjes su spyod pa la dbyug gu dang tho ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying po dang rjes su spyod pa la dbyug gu dang tho ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: Garbha and Anuyāyin should be drawn holding a club and a hammer.

original: las thams cad pa la rdo rje'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la rdo rje'o //
translated: Sarvakarmāntakṛt should be drawn holding a vajra.

original: shar gyi sgor sman thams cad dang / rgyan thams @116a *//
analyzed: shar gyi sgor sman thams cad dang / rgyan thams @116a *//
translated: At the eastern gate, one should place all medicines, all ornaments,

original: cad dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / grub pa'i rdzas la sogs pa dang / smig sman dang / ldong ros dang / ral gri dang / rin po che sngon du 'gro ba gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: cad dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / grub pa'i rdzas la sogs pa dang / smig sman dang / ldong ros dang / ral gri dang / rin po che sngon du 'gro ba gzhag par bya'o //
translated: mercury, elixirs, the daughters of the asuras, the substances of the adepts, and so forth, as well as collyrium, vermilion, swords, and precious substances.

original: lho'i sgor lha ma yin brgyad ni /
analyzed: lho'i sgor lha ma yin brgyad ni /
translated: At the southern gate, one should place the eight asuras:

original: stobs can dang / stobs can gyi bu dang / bde mchog dang / thag bzang ris dang / bde ldan dang / dus kyi mu khyud dang / gzhan len dang / dbyig za'o //🔽nub kyi sgor 'khrul 'khor brgya rtsa brgyad gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs can dang / stobs can gyi bu dang / bde mchog dang / thag bzang ris dang / bde ldan dang / dus kyi mu khyud dang / gzhan len dang / dbyig za'o // nub kyi sgor 'khrul 'khor brgya rtsa brgyad gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Bala, Balī, Śakra, Vemacitrin, Śiva, Kālacakrin, Pariveṣa, and Vṛtra.🔽At the western gate, one should place the one hundred and eight machines.

original: de'ang brgyad rnam pa dang bcas pa bri ste /
analyzed: de'ang brgyad rnam pa dang bcas pa bri ste /
translated: One should draw the eight with their forms.

original: srad bu dang / gri gug dang / bud med dang / seng+ge dang / lug dang / mda' dang bcas pa'i gzhu dang / chu rgyun dang / sbyin dang / 'do li dang / bdag nyid kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams so //
analyzed: srad bu dang / gri gug dang / bud med dang / seng+ge dang / lug dang / mda' dang bcas pa'i gzhu dang / chu rgyun dang / sbyin dang / 'do li dang / bdag nyid kyi 'khrul 'khor rnams so //
translated: a thread, a sword, a woman, a lion, a sheep, an arrow and a bow, a stream, a gift, a swing, and a machine for oneself.

original: byang gi sgor bu ga brgyad pa dang bcas pa bri ste /
analyzed: byang gi sgor bu ga brgyad pa dang bcas pa bri ste /
translated: At the northern gate, one should draw an eight-spoked wheel.

original: de'ang lug gi rnam pa dang / chu srin gyi rnam pa dang / glang po'i gdong gi rnam pa dang / lto 'phye'i rnam pa dang / byi ba'i rnam pa dang / mi'i gdong gi rnam pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang / ma byas pa'i gdong gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang lug gi rnam pa dang / chu srin gyi rnam pa dang / glang po'i gdong gi rnam pa dang / lto 'phye'i rnam pa dang / byi ba'i rnam pa dang / mi'i gdong gi rnam pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang / ma byas pa'i gdong gi rnam pa'o //
translated: It has the form of a sheep, the form of a crocodile, the form of an elephant face, the form of a tortoise, the form of a rat, the form of a human face, the form of a maṇḍala, and the form of an unfinished face.

original: stegs bu'i mtshams rnams su sgo bral bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: stegs bu'i mtshams rnams su sgo bral bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: At the corners of the platform, one should draw four doorless rooms.

original: me'i phyogs su me'i thab khung ngo //🔽bden bral du bdug spos kyi thab khung ngo //
analyzed: me'i phyogs su me'i thab khung ngo // bden bral du bdug spos kyi thab khung ngo //
translated: In the fire direction, a fire pit.🔽In the direction of the demigods, a fumigation pit.

original: rlung gi mtshams rnams su chu'i thab khung ngo //
analyzed: rlung gi mtshams rnams su chu'i thab khung ngo //
translated: In the wind direction, a water pit.

original: dbang ldan du rus sbal gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du rus sbal gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the direction of Indra, one should place a tortoise.

original: de nas dri thams cad dang / me tog @116b thams cad dang / bdug pa thams cad dang / 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma dang / mchod pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dri thams cad dang / me tog @116b thams cad dang / bdug pa thams cad dang / 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma dang / mchod pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, all the perfumes, all the flowers, all the incense, all the food offerings, and all the offerings should be given.

original: de nas skyes bu dpa' bo dag gi dri zhim pos yan lag byugs la shin tu phra ba'i ras kyis gdong g-yogs te srung ba byas la 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma'i bya ba byas la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas skyes bu dpa' bo dag gi dri zhim pos yan lag byugs la shin tu phra ba'i ras kyis gdong g-yogs te srung ba byas la 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma'i bya ba byas la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, the hero should anoint his limbs with fragrant substances, cover his face with a very fine cloth, perform the protection, and enter, having performed the duties of the master of the maṇḍala.

original: spyan drang ba dang gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas so; ;'dir rdul tshon gyis bris pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //🔽de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba'i skyes bu dpa' bo de la bla mas rjes su gnang ba byin la dam tshig shes pas 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma'i phyag rgya'am /
analyzed: spyan drang ba dang gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas so; ;'dir rdul tshon gyis bris pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o // de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba'i skyes bu dpa' bo de la bla mas rjes su gnang ba byin la dam tshig shes pas 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma'i phyag rgya'am /
translated: He should invite the deities and request them to depart, and so forth. Here, the maṇḍala drawn with colored powders should be shown.

original: lha ma yin gyi phyag rgya bcings pas dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi phyag rgya bcings pas dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The master should give permission to the hero who has seen such a maṇḍala. The master of the maṇḍala should enthrall him with the knowledge of the commitments, binding the asura mudrā.

original: lha ma yin gyi chung ma dang khyim rnams su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi chung ma dang khyim rnams su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will enter the wives and homes of the demigods.

original: gzhan len gyis byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rdzas rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dug 'joms shing gzhon nu rnams skyed 'phel ba dang / mchod sbyin gyi bgegs sel ba dang / tshangs pa'i srin po srung ba dang / drag po dang skem byed kyis bzung ba dang / gang dag lus srul pos bzung ba dang / bud med mngal nyams pa rnams kyis nyer gnas la byugs pas bzang por 'gyur ba dang / de dag gis yan @124a *//
translated: It will destroy poison, increase youthfulness, remove obstacles to sacrifice, protect against the rākṣasa Brahmā, and cure those seized by Rudra and Mṛtyu, those seized by the body-snatchers, and women with damaged wombs.

original: lag byugs pa gang yin pas ni /
analyzed: lag byugs pa gang yin pas ni /
translated: By anointing the body with these,

analyzed: sgo bsgribs pa de grol nas gang dag mtshams ring du sbyar ba'i rlung yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: The opening of the door is closed with a plug of wood, such as a branch of madhuka, karṇaja, or nyagrodha trees, and the door is completely covered with a door-panel.

original: gang dag nang na gnas pa'i me rab tu zhi ba ni /
analyzed: gang dag nang na gnas pa'i me rab tu zhi ba ni /

original: sbyor ba'o // de nas skyes bu dpa' bos ba ser skya'i lci ba sa la ma lhung bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs la bu ga'i sgor mchod pa dang gtor ma'i cho ga byas te aa pa marga'i ya ma shing la me rab tu sbar la /

original: aa pa marga'i 'bras bu dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi btags te sreg blug brgya rtsa brgyad khro bo'i 'khrul 'khor gyi bla mas dbul bar bya'o //

translated: One should offer one hundred and eight oblations of the fruit of the emblic myrobalan, mixed with ghee and honey, with the mantra of the master of the maṇḍala of Aṭṭahāsa.

analyzed: 'dis 'khrul 'khor thams cad ltung ba dang brlag par 'gyur ro //

translated: The two kinds of indigo, which are placed in a white gourd, destroy the poison of snakes, accomplish the desired aim, protect young men, make women fortunate, and remove all the torments of passion.

translated: It is said that it pacifies disputes, grants the boon of dominion over the earth, always destroys all enemies, and subjugates at sunrise.

original: 'dir 'di dag gis lus la byugs la /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dag gis lus la byugs la /
translated: Here, one should anoint one's body with these,

analyzed: ra'i pags pa'i ral gu gyon te /

analyzed: byi ba'i rnam pa yin na byi ba'i zhag dang / chu srin gyi zhag snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: ji ltar glang po'i gdong gi rnam pa yin na /

translated: as before, with tortoise fat.

analyzed: mi'i gdong gi rnam pa yin na /

analyzed: mi'i zhag gis shal ma li'i dog pa'i sdong bu stang du bzhag la mun pa'i phyogs su gzung bar bya /

translated: One should smear it with the fat of one whose face is in a certain condition, and light it while reciting the mantra of the Cakrasaṃvara wheel twenty-one times.

original: mun pa mun nag thams cad 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag thams cad 'joms par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ta ka ra'i me tog dang / ru rta dang / spang @125a *//

analyzed: chur 'jug pa dang / dug gi du ba dang / dug gi rlung gis rang gi rkang mthil dang / spyi gtsug gi bar du yongs su byugs la 'jug go /

analyzed: de dag thams cad las srung ba byas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zlos shing 'jug par bya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzi brjid lta bur thams cad kyis tshugs par mi nus te /

analyzed: zhugs pa dang / rnga'i dbyug gu la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas la brdung par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas lha chen po'i lho'i sa la bsdad la 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma bzla'o //

analyzed: zhugs pa dang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs shig ces 'phrin yig gdas par byed do //
translated: He should write a letter saying, “Please stay as long as you are able.”

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje rtag tu rjes su dran pas bzla bar bya'o //
translated: He should recite while constantly remembering the Three Jewels and Noble Vajrapāṇi.

original: 'di ltar bud med kyi dbus su nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma gnas kyi bar du sdod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bud med kyi dbus su nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma gnas kyi bar du sdod do //

original: ji srid 'gro bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ji srid 'gro bar 'dod na /

analyzed: des sbyar sman gyis bsku ba byugs la /
translated: he should anoint himself with the medicinal ointment.

original: dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / grub pa'i rdzas gang 'dod pa de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / grub pa'i rdzas gang 'dod pa de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: He should take with him mercury, elixir, or whatever other alchemical substance he desires.

analyzed: gzhu'i 'khrul 'khor las byol la yungs kar la lan bdun bzlas la bsnun par bya'o //
translated: He should shoot the mustard seeds at the machine with the bow, while reciting the mantra seven times.

original: de lta na yang mi ltung na /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi ltung na /
translated: If it still does not fall,

original: de nas 'khrul 'khor de la lto'i rtsa ba nas bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'khrul 'khor de la lto'i rtsa ba nas bsnun par bya'o //
translated: he should then shoot the machine with the bow at the base of the belly.

original: de nas ltung ngo //
analyzed: de nas ltung ngo //
translated: Then it will fall.

original: thog mar 'khor rnams sngon du btang la bdag nyid phyi nas 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar 'khor rnams sngon du btang la bdag nyid phyi nas 'jug par bya'o //
translated: First, he should send the retinue ahead, and then he himself should enter.

original: mar me'i mchod sdong la sbyin sreg gi gi thab nas me sbar la 'jug go /🔽khron pa rnams su 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma stong phrag @126a *//
analyzed: mar me'i mchod sdong la sbyin sreg gi gi thab nas me sbar la 'jug go / khron pa rnams su 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma stong phrag @126a *//
translated: Light the fire in the sacrificial hearth of the lamp-pillar.

original: brgyad bzlas pas sgo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brgyad bzlas pas sgo 'byung ngo //
translated: In the wells, the wheels will be released by reciting the mantra of the guru one thousand and eight times.

original: khron pa de na yang ta la'i shing sbrul gyi rnam par snang ba la dri ma med pa'i mig sman dang / rgya spos dang / ru rta dang / b'a l'a dang / spang spos dang / ldong ros dang / gi wang rnams mnyam por skar ma rgyal la sbyar ba'i ril bur byas la sman gyi mchog dug 'joms pa de shes rab can gyis bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: khron pa de na yang ta la'i shing sbrul gyi rnam par snang ba la dri ma med pa'i mig sman dang / rgya spos dang / ru rta dang / b'a l'a dang / spang spos dang / ldong ros dang / gi wang rnams mnyam por skar ma rgyal la sbyar ba'i ril bur byas la sman gyi mchog dug 'joms pa de shes rab can gyis bsnun par bya'o //
translated: In the wells, there will be a palm tree appearing in the form of a snake. The wise one should apply the eye medicine, agaru, camphor, bālaka, spang spos, realgar, and guggulu, all mixed together, under the Puṣya constellation, in the form of a pill. That supreme medicine, which conquers poison, should be applied by the wise one.

original: de nas ta la'i shing nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽'di ni / bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas ta la'i shing nyid du 'gyur ro // 'di ni / bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the palm tree will become a tree.🔽This was spoken by Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi.

original: 'phags pa phyag na rdo rjes bka' stsal ba'i 'khrul 'khor 'ba' zhig ba'i le'u ste lnga ba'o ////
analyzed: 'phags pa phyag na rdo rjes bka' stsal ba'i 'khrul 'khor 'ba' zhig ba'i le'u ste lnga ba'o ////
translated: This is the fifth chapter of the Wheel of Time Tantra, which is the sole speech of Noble Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi gnas na gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi gnas na gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One was dwelling in the abode of the domain of the Tathāgatas together with the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi:

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: “Vajrapāṇi,

original: ji ltar lha ma yin thams cad kyi dregs pa gzhom pa dang / dam tshig la gnas par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje khro bo'i dam tshig 'di sgrogs shig /
analyzed: ji ltar lha ma yin thams cad kyi dregs pa gzhom pa dang / dam tshig la gnas par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje khro bo'i dam tshig 'di sgrogs shig /
translated: proclaim this pledge of Vajra Wrath in order to subdue the arrogance of all the asuras and to establish them in the pledge.”

original: de nas lag na rdo rje stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das la btud nas thal mo sbyar te phyag byas nas rdo rje khro bos smras so //
analyzed: de nas lag na rdo rje stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das la btud nas thal mo sbyar te phyag byas nas rdo rje khro bos smras so //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, knelt down on his right knee, bowed to the Blessed One, joined his palms, and said this to Vajra Wrath:

original: smras pa tsam gyis rdo rje khro bo'i rgyal po me lce gcig tu 'bar te 'jig @126b rten gsum bkang nas sgra chen po phyung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa tsam gyis rdo rje khro bo'i rgyal po me lce gcig tu 'bar te 'jig @126b rten gsum bkang nas sgra chen po phyung ngo //
translated: As soon as he said this, the King of Vajra Wrath blazed with a single flame of fire, filled the three worlds, and let out a great sound.

original: de nas de lta bu'i mtshan ma chen po des lha ma yin 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad 'dir lha dang lha ma yin rnams g-yul 'gyed par gyur to snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas de lta bu'i mtshan ma chen po des lha ma yin 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad 'dir lha dang lha ma yin rnams g-yul 'gyed par gyur to snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, with such a great sign, all the asuras and their retinues thought, “Here the gods and asuras will wage war.”

original: lha ma yin rnams la thags bzang ris dang / stobs can dang / rnam par snang byed dang / rab bde dang / bde mchog dang / dus kyi mu khyud dang / dbyig za dang / rus sbal la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams la thags bzang ris dang / stobs can dang / rnam par snang byed dang / rab bde dang / bde mchog dang / dus kyi mu khyud dang / dbyig za dang / rus sbal la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The asuras, including Vemacitrin, Bali, Vairocana, Subhadra, Śakra, Kālachakra, Śakra, Kūrma, and so forth, together with their retinues,

original: gzhan yang bgrod dka' chen po dang / glog gi lce dang / sgra gcan dang / snang ba'i phreng ba can dang / 'phrog byed ser skya la sogs pa dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin gyi rjes su dpyod pa dpung dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang bgrod dka' chen po dang / glog gi lce dang / sgra gcan dang / snang ba'i phreng ba can dang / 'phrog byed ser skya la sogs pa dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin gyi rjes su dpyod pa dpung dang bcas pa /
translated: and others, including Mahāduḥkha, Vidyujjibhā, Rāhu, Jyotiṣprabha, and the yellow Harīta, together with their armies,

original: gzhon pa dang bcas pa 'dus te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der lhags so //
analyzed: gzhon pa dang bcas pa 'dus te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der lhags so //
translated: and the young ones, gathered and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: lha rnams kyis kyang de lta bu'i mtshan ma chen po de mthong nas lha'i tshogs gzhan rnams dang / rang rang gi rnam par rtog pa ji lta de ltar lha rnams kyi dbang po la smra zhing bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der lhags te thal mo sbyar nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang de lta bu'i mtshan ma chen po de mthong nas lha'i tshogs gzhan rnams dang / rang rang gi rnam par rtog pa ji lta de ltar lha rnams kyi dbang po la smra zhing bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der lhags te thal mo sbyar nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: The gods, having seen such a great sign, spoke to the lord of the gods and to the other gods, each according to their own thoughts, and then approached the Blessed One. They joined their palms together and sat to one side.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi:

original: lag na rdo rje //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje //
translated: “Vajrapāṇi,

original: gang 'dir dus la bab bar shes na /
analyzed: gang 'dir dus la bab bar shes na /
translated: if you know that the time has come,

original: deng 'dir sa 'og gi dbang bskur ba rnga'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya bas byin gyis rlobs shig /
analyzed: deng 'dir sa 'og gi dbang bskur ba rnga'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya bas byin gyis rlobs shig /
translated: now bestow the consecration of the underworld through the blessing of the sound of the drum,

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / don dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / don dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many people.”

original: bcom ldan @127a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan @127a *//
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'das; bdag gis theg pa chen po la dad pa dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu'i don du dam tshig bstan pas byin gyis brlab lags kyi //
analyzed: 'das; bdag gis theg pa chen po la dad pa dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu'i don du dam tshig bstan pas byin gyis brlab lags kyi //
translated: I will bestow the blessing through the teaching of the commitments for the benefit of the sons of good family who have faith in the Mahāyāna.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: Blessed One, may the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, bless it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang byin gyis brlabs lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang byin gyis brlabs lags so //
translated: It has also been blessed by other Tathāgatas.

original: de bdag gis kyang byin gyis brlab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bdag gis kyang byin gyis brlab par bgyi'o //
translated: I too will bless it.

original: dbang ldan gyi phyogs su bsdad la gnas mchog der mgal dum dang / rdo ba dor te 'khrul 'khor dang shing sdong spangs la /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi phyogs su bsdad la gnas mchog der mgal dum dang / rdo ba dor te 'khrul 'khor dang shing sdong spangs la /
translated: One should stand in the northeast direction and cast there a clod of earth and a stone, avoiding a machine and a tree trunk.

original: gzhan yang bsang gtor dang / lha'i mchod sbyin dang / dkyil 'khor dang / dbang bskur ba byas pa dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / gnod sbyin mchod pa byas pa dang / dge 'dun dbang bskur ba'i gnas rnams dor la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsang gtor dang / lha'i mchod sbyin dang / dkyil 'khor dang / dbang bskur ba byas pa dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / gnod sbyin mchod pa byas pa dang / dge 'dun dbang bskur ba'i gnas rnams dor la /
translated: One should also avoid a place for a burnt offering, a divine sacrifice, a maṇḍala, an empowerment, a place for the worship of obstacles, evil spirits, and yakṣas, and an empowerment of the saṅgha.

original: der yang chu snum pa dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / ri bo dang / snum pa'i phyogs mtshon par byas la /
analyzed: der yang chu snum pa dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / ri bo dang / snum pa'i phyogs mtshon par byas la /
translated: There, one should indicate a place with oily water, a lake, a pond, a mountain, or an oily place.

original: de rnams su sngon bzhin du byi dor dang yongs su sbyang ba byas te tshon sna lngas gru bzhi sgo bzhi ba'i ri mo bris la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus cha brgyad par byas te yungs kar dkar pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje gra bzhir gzhag par bya'o
analyzed: de rnams su sngon bzhin du byi dor dang yongs su sbyang ba byas te tshon sna lngas gru bzhi sgo bzhi ba'i ri mo bris la dkyil 'khor gyi dbus cha brgyad par byas te yungs kar dkar pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje gra bzhir gzhag par bya'o
translated: In those, as before, having done the cleaning and the complete preparation, having drawn the lines of the four corners and four gates with five colors, having divided the center of the mandala into eight parts, one should place a vajra consecrated with white mustard seeds in the four corners.

original: // de'i dbus su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: // de'i dbus su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of that one should draw the Blessed Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas kyi drung du 'phags pa phyag na rdo @127b rje 'bar ba'i phyag can gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas kyi drung du 'phags pa phyag na rdo @127b rje 'bar ba'i phyag can gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the right of the Blessed One one should place the Noble Vajrapāṇi, with a blazing hand.

original: de'i drung du khro bo'i rgyal po rdo rje sa 'og rdo rje dgra sta'i phyag can gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i drung du khro bo'i rgyal po rdo rje sa 'og rdo rje dgra sta'i phyag can gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To his right one should place the King of Wrathful Ones, Vajrapātāla, with a vajra and a dagger in his hands.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yon gyi drung du byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros rnga yab kyi phyag can gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yon gyi drung du byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med pa'i blo gros rnga yab kyi phyag can gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the left of the Blessed One one should place the Bodhisattva Vimaladatta, with a yak-tail fan in his hand.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du lha chen po chung ma dang bcas pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du lha chen po chung ma dang bcas pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The great god with his wife should be placed in front of the Blessed One.

original: de'i mdun du khyu mchog kha 'og tu lta ba nag po'i gos can gzhag go /
analyzed: de'i mdun du khyu mchog kha 'og tu lta ba nag po'i gos can gzhag go /
translated: In front of him, one should place a black bull with its head lowered.

original: shar gyi sgor sman thams cad gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: shar gyi sgor sman thams cad gzhag par bya ste /
translated: At the eastern gate, one should place all the herbs:

original: ae ra ba ti dang / me kha ba ti dang / dzyo ti ra sa dang / be ga ba ti dang / s'urya ba ti dang / aa dza gandha dang / yaksha ka n-ya ste /
analyzed: ae ra ba ti dang / me kha ba ti dang / dzyo ti ra sa dang / be ga ba ti dang / s'urya ba ti dang / aa dza gandha dang / yaksha ka n-ya ste /
translated: Eravati, Mekhavatī, Jyotirasa, Vegavati, Sūryavatī, Ajasgandhā, and Yakṣakaṇṭhā.

original: sman chen po 'di brgyad gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sman chen po 'di brgyad gzhag par bya'o //
translated: These eight great herbs should be placed.

original: de'i gzugs ni /
analyzed: de'i gzugs ni /
translated: Their forms

original: sengge dang / khyu mchog dang / bya rgod dang / rus sbal dang / sbal ba dang / rtsangs pa dang me 'bar ba dang / dngul chu rnams gnas rnams su go rim bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sengge dang / khyu mchog dang / bya rgod dang / rus sbal dang / sbal ba dang / rtsangs pa dang me 'bar ba dang / dngul chu rnams gnas rnams su go rim bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: should be drawn in the proper places: a lion, a bull, a vulture, a tortoise, a frog, a lizard, a blazing fire, and mercury.

original: sman rnams dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / rigs kyi bud med kyi dbyibs su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sman rnams dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / rigs kyi bud med kyi dbyibs su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The herbs should be placed in the shape of mercury, elixir, and a noble woman.

original: rgyan rnams dang / grub pa'i rdzas rnams dang / ldong ros dang / mig sman dang / gi wang dang / bum pa bzang po dang / rkang byug dang / mchod phyir thogs dang / 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / dbyug gu dang /
analyzed: rgyan rnams dang / grub pa'i rdzas rnams dang / ldong ros dang / mig sman dang / gi wang dang / bum pa bzang po dang / rkang byug dang / mchod phyir thogs dang / 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / dbyug gu dang /
translated: the ornaments, the substances of accomplishment, the collyrium, the eye medicine, the unguent, the excellent vase, the foot ointment, the necklace, the wheel, the sword, the club,

original: rtse gsum dang / zhags pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtse gsum dang / zhags pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: the trident, the noose, and so forth.

original: de'i lho'i sgor lha ma yin brgyad bri ste /
analyzed: de'i lho'i sgor lha ma yin brgyad bri ste /
translated: At its southern gate, one should draw eight asuras:

original: stobs can dang / stobs can gyi bu dang / bde mchog dang / @128a *//
analyzed: stobs can dang / stobs can gyi bu dang / bde mchog dang / @128a *//
translated: Bala, Balabhadra, Śiva,

original: dus kyi mu khyud dang / thags bzang ris dang / rab bde dang / gzhan len dang / dbyig za'o //
analyzed: dus kyi mu khyud dang / thags bzang ris dang / rab bde dang / gzhan len dang / dbyig za'o //
translated: Kālacakrin, Vemacitrin, Subhadra, Parākrama, and Vaiśravaṇa.

original: nub kyi sgor 'khrul 'khor sum cu lhag pa'i stong gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgor 'khrul 'khor sum cu lhag pa'i stong gzhag par bya'o //
translated: At its western gate, one should place a thousand and thirty-three yantras.

original: de la 'khrul 'khor chen po brgyad rnam pa dang bcas pa gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'khrul 'khor chen po brgyad rnam pa dang bcas pa gzhag par bya ste /
translated: There, one should place eight great yantras with their aspects.

original: de la srad bu dang / gri gug dang / bud med dang / gzhi'i 'khrul 'khor dang / 'phang 'dzin pa'i lag pa dang / 'og tu lta ba'i tshul dang / gzhi'i 'khrul 'khor la lta ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la srad bu dang / gri gug dang / bud med dang / gzhi'i 'khrul 'khor dang / 'phang 'dzin pa'i lag pa dang / 'og tu lta ba'i tshul dang / gzhi'i 'khrul 'khor la lta ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: There, one should draw a thread, a curved knife, a woman, a base maṇḍala, a hand holding a scale, a downward-looking posture, and a base maṇḍala to be looked at.

original: de nas sengge dang / lug dang / chu srin dang / glang po che dang / lto 'phye'i rnam pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang / ma byas pa'i gdong dang / dpal gyi sgo 'di brgyad rnam pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sengge dang / lug dang / chu srin dang / glang po che dang / lto 'phye'i rnam pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang / ma byas pa'i gdong dang / dpal gyi sgo 'di brgyad rnam pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should draw the forms of a lion, a sheep, a crocodile, an elephant, and a tortoise, the form of a maṇḍala, an unfinished face, and this door of glory with its eight aspects.

original: gdong gi 'khrul 'khor mchu btsum pa bri bar bya'o; ;lug gi spyi bor phur bu'i 'khrul 'khor bri bar bya'o //🔽mda' dang bcas pa'i gzhu dang / chu rgyun gyi lte bar phur bu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gdong gi 'khrul 'khor mchu btsum pa bri bar bya'o; ;lug gi spyi bor phur bu'i 'khrul 'khor bri bar bya'o // mda' dang bcas pa'i gzhu dang / chu rgyun gyi lte bar phur bu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala of the face with the lips closed. One should draw the maṇḍala of the dagger on the head of the sheep.🔽One should place the dagger in the center of the bow with the arrow.

original: sbyin dang / 'dal gru bzhi ba dang / bskor ba'i 'khrul 'khor bri'o //
analyzed: sbyin dang / 'dal gru bzhi ba dang / bskor ba'i 'khrul 'khor bri'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala of the square pond and the revolving maṇḍala.

original: gnyis dang / 'od 'phro ba'i rnam pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis dang / 'od 'phro ba'i rnam pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the two and the form of the radiating light.

original: de'ang go rim bzhin du rnam pa dang bcas pa'i 'khrul 'khor la phur bu bsnun pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang go rim bzhin du rnam pa dang bcas pa'i 'khrul 'khor la phur bu bsnun pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the wheel with the spokes, along with the nails, in the same order.

original: de nas byang gi sgor bu ga rnam pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas byang gi sgor bu ga rnam pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya ste /
translated: Then, at the northern gate, one should draw the holes with the shapes,

original: sengge dang / lug dang / chu srin dang / glang po che'i gdong dang / lto 'phye'i gdong dang / ba lang gi dgod @128b dang; dkyil 'khor dang / ma byas pa'i gdong gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sengge dang / lug dang / chu srin dang / glang po che'i gdong dang / lto 'phye'i gdong dang / ba lang gi dgod @128b dang; dkyil 'khor dang / ma byas pa'i gdong gi rnam pa ste /
translated: the faces of a lion, a sheep, a crocodile, an elephant, a tortoise, an ox, a maṇḍala, and an unmade face.

original: dpal gyi sgo brgyad phur bus bsnun pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpal gyi sgo brgyad phur bus bsnun pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the eight doors of glory with the shapes of the nails.

original: de'i dbus su chu rgyun dbyug gu dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su chu rgyun dbyug gu dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, one should draw the water stream with the staff.

original: gra bzhir sgo bral bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gra bzhir sgo bral bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the four corners, one should draw the four doors without doors.

original: mar me'i thab khung ngo //🔽bden bral du du ba'i thab khung ngo //
analyzed: mar me'i thab khung ngo // bden bral du du ba'i thab khung ngo //
translated: The lamp hearth.🔽In the south-west, the smoke hearth.

original: rlung du chu'i thab khung ngo //
analyzed: rlung du chu'i thab khung ngo //
translated: In the north-west, the water hearth.

original: dbang ldan du sbrul gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du sbrul gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the north-east, one should place a snake.

original: de nas ras dkar po phra ba dri zhim pa'i gdugs bzhi dang / dbyig dang bcas pa'i nor bus byin gyis brlabs la shin tu bri zhim pa'i chu gtsang mas yongs su bkang ba'i bum pa rtsa ba nag po med cing dri zhim pos yongs su byugs pa gzhag go /
analyzed: de nas ras dkar po phra ba dri zhim pa'i gdugs bzhi dang / dbyig dang bcas pa'i nor bus byin gyis brlabs la shin tu bri zhim pa'i chu gtsang mas yongs su bkang ba'i bum pa rtsa ba nag po med cing dri zhim pos yongs su byugs pa gzhag go /
translated: Then, having consecrated four white fragrant cloths with jewels and gold, one should place a vase filled with clean water, fragrant and without black roots, on the four corners of the outer maṇḍala.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs gra bzhi ba'i shar gyi sgor gnas gcig tu lha ma yin gyi dbang po chen po stobs can dang / bgrod dka' chen po bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs gra bzhi ba'i shar gyi sgor gnas gcig tu lha ma yin gyi dbang po chen po stobs can dang / bgrod dka' chen po bri bar bya'o //
translated: At the eastern gate, one should draw the great powerful lord of the asuras, Mahendra, and Mahāduḥkha.

original: de'i lhor rnam par snang byed dang / ha ri ta'i pi ga la zhes bya ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lhor rnam par snang byed dang / ha ri ta'i pi ga la zhes bya ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: To his south, one should draw Vairocana and Hariti.

original: de'i nub kyi sgor snang ba'i phreng ba can dang / rnga bo che ste /
analyzed: de'i nub kyi sgor snang ba'i phreng ba can dang / rnga bo che ste /
translated: At his western gate, one should draw the asura lords Prabhāmaṇḍala and Mahādundubhi.

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po de dag bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po de dag bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw those asura lords.

original: de nas mchod pa sha med pa'i lha bshos bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa sha med pa'i lha bshos bya ba ste /
translated: Then, one should make offerings of food without meat.

original: gcig ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: gcig ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: One should offer one to the Blessed Buddha.

original: gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second

original: dri ma med pa'i blo gros la'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i blo gros la'o //
translated: To Vimaladatta.

original: gsum pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa ni /
translated: The third

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: To Vajradhara.

original: bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni /
translated: The fourth

original: khro bo'i rgyal po la'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po la'o //
translated: To Krodharaja.

original: lnga pa ni /
analyzed: lnga pa ni /
translated: The fifth

original: lha chen po la'o //
analyzed: lha chen po la'o //
translated: To Mahakala.

original: de nas @129a *//
analyzed: de nas @129a *//
translated: Then,

analyzed: ji ltar 'byor pas lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams kyi gtor ma dang / 'byung po thams cad ba'i gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: according to one's means, one should give the sacrificial cake to the lords of the asuras and the sacrificial cake to all the bhutas.

analyzed: de nas dri thams cad dang / me tog dang / phye ma la sogs pa'i lha bshos sbyin no //
translated: Then one should give the divine food of all the scents, flowers, powders, and so forth.

analyzed: de nas lha rnams 'ching bar byed pa'i sngags ni /
translated: Then the mantra for binding the gods is:
