analyzed: aom badzra garbhe badzra garbhye phat h'a dhi ki ri ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Om vajra garbha vajra garbhye phat hadhikirini svaha.

original: de nas mtshams bzhir lag pa phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs pas log 'dren bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshams bzhir lag pa phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs pas log 'dren bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the four directions, one should bind the evil forces with the mudra of the hands empowered.

original: de'i sngags ni /🔽na ma: sa manta badzra n'am/
analyzed: de'i sngags ni / na ma: sa manta badzra n'am/
translated: Its mantra is:🔽Namah samantabuddhanaam.

original: aom bdzra p'a la ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bdzra p'a la ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Om vajra pala svaha.

original: zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
translated: This is recited three times.

original: rdo rje lcags sgrog gis bcing ba dang dgug par ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags sgrog gis bcing ba dang dgug par ba'o //
translated: One should bind with the vajra fetters and summon.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lha thams cad me tog gis dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / lha thams cad me tog gis dgug par bya'o //
translated: One should summon the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and all gods with flowers.

original: na ma stree ya dhvi kva n'am/
analyzed: na ma stree ya dhvi kva n'am/
translated: Namaḥ streya-dhva-kṣaṇām

original: sarba ta th'a ga t'a n'am/
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga t'a n'am/
translated: sarva-tathāgatānām

original: aa na la bh'a k'a n'am na ma: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aa na la bh'a k'a n'am na ma: sv'a h'a /
translated: anala-bhā-kṣaṇām namaḥ svāhā.

original: de nas skyes bu dpa' bos sngags 'dis bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas skyes bu dpa' bos sngags 'dis bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: Then the hero should protect with this mantra:

original: aom du rba re dzva la dzva la na mo badzra s'a ga r'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽'dis bsrungs nas ras dkar po phra ba dri zhim pos gdong g-yogs te 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma bzlas la skyes bu dba' bos chos kyi gru lta bu'i shing lham gon te lag pa g-yas pa rus sbal gyi phyag rgya'am /
analyzed: aom du rba re dzva la dzva la na mo badzra s'a ga r'a ya sv'a h'a / 'dis bsrungs nas ras dkar po phra ba dri zhim pos gdong g-yogs te 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma bzlas la skyes bu dba' bos chos kyi gru lta bu'i shing lham gon te lag pa g-yas pa rus sbal gyi phyag rgya'am /
translated: Oṃ durva re jvala jvala namo vajra-sāgara-āya svāhā.

original: lha ma yin gyi phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Having protected with this, one should cover the face with a fine white cloth scented with perfume. The hero should wear shoes like a ship of Dharma, and make the tortoise mudrā or the asura mudrā with the right hand.

original: rtsa ba nag po med pa'i bum pa lo ma bzang po dang ldan pa'i chus shar gyi sgor 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma zlos shing dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba nag po med pa'i bum pa lo ma bzang po dang ldan pa'i chus shar gyi sgor 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma zlos shing dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: With water from a pot without a black base, but with good leaves, one should sprinkle the guru of the machine at the eastern door, reciting the mantra.

original: de ltar dbang @129b bskur ba de'i rjes su lag pa rdo rje'i phyag rgyas me tog dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbang @129b bskur ba de'i rjes su lag pa rdo rje'i phyag rgyas me tog dor ro //
translated: After that empowerment, one should cast a flower with the vajra-hand gesture.

original: me tog gang la lhung ba de'i lha'i rigs 'grub bo //
analyzed: me tog gang la lhung ba de'i lha'i rigs 'grub bo //
translated: The flower falls on the deity of that family.

original: de nas gdong bcings pa bkrol la dbang bskur ba de la skyes bu dpa' bos dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gdong bcings pa bkrol la dbang bskur ba de la skyes bu dpa' bos dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //
translated: Then, having untied the blindfold, the hero should show the maṇḍala to the one who has been empowered.

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams kyi gnas dang / mtshon cha dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / bud med kyi tshogs dang / grub pa'i rdzas dang / de dag gi dkyil 'khor mthong na /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams kyi gnas dang / mtshon cha dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / bud med kyi tshogs dang / grub pa'i rdzas dang / de dag gi dkyil 'khor mthong na /
translated: If the abode of the lords of the asuras, their weapons, mercury, elixirs, hosts of women, and the substances of their accomplishments are seen in the maṇḍala,

original: lha dang / lha ma yin gyi dam tshig gi tshogs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / lha ma yin gyi dam tshig gi tshogs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will go to the assembly of the commitments of the gods and asuras.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa ma byas kyang 'khrul 'khor 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa ma byas kyang 'khrul 'khor 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one has not performed prior service, the machine will be destroyed.

original: de dag gis nye bar mi rtsed do //
analyzed: de dag gis nye bar mi rtsed do //
translated: They do not play with them.

original: lha ma yin thams cad kyi khang pa dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / bud med dang / mtshon cha dang / rgyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnam pa sna tshogs pa des dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽sgyur mas sprul pa'am //
analyzed: lha ma yin thams cad kyi khang pa dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / bud med dang / mtshon cha dang / rgyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnam pa sna tshogs pa des dbang du 'gyur ro // sgyur mas sprul pa'am //
translated: With that various kind of machinery, such as the palaces of all the demigods, the elixirs, the magic potions, the women, the weapons, the ornaments, the illusions, and so forth, one will enthrall them.🔽One will be able to cause the emanations of the illusionist to fall down,

original: lha ma yin gyi sprul pa rnams sam //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sprul pa rnams sam //
translated: or the emanations of the demigods,

original: gzhan yang srang srong dang / grub pas rab tu sbyar ba'i 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa ltung ba dang / dbang du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang srang srong dang / grub pas rab tu sbyar ba'i 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa ltung ba dang / dbang du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: or also the machinery that is well-deployed by the sages and the adepts.

original: gang dag dpal gyi sgor 'jug par 'dod na /
analyzed: gang dag dpal gyi sgor 'jug par 'dod na /
translated: Those who wish to enter the door of glory

original: sngon du rdo rje khro bos bzlas la dpal gyi sgor brjod pa dang / sbyor bas sreg pa la sogs pa byas te ba ser skya'i lci bas dkyil 'khor byugs la gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas kha'i rnam pa'i thub khung gi steng du aa pa marga'i yam shing la me sbar la /
analyzed: sngon du rdo rje khro bos bzlas la dpal gyi sgor brjod pa dang / sbyor bas sreg pa la sogs pa byas te ba ser skya'i lci bas dkyil 'khor byugs la gtor ma'i cho ga byas nas kha'i rnam pa'i thub khung gi steng du aa pa marga'i yam shing la me sbar la /
translated: First, having recited the vajra wrathful one, one should say the door of glory, and having performed the burning of the union, and so on, one should anoint the maṇḍala with yellow cow dung, and having performed the rite of the bali offering, one should light a fire on the skull of a Brahmin with sticks of the bodhi tree.🔽

original: aa pa marga'i @130a *//
analyzed: aa pa marga'i @130a *//
translated: First, having recited the Vajra Wrath mantra, one should announce it at the door of glory, and having performed the burning of the ritual dagger and so forth, one should anoint the maṇḍala with the dung of a tawny cow, perform the rite of the sacrificial cakes, and light a fire on the top of the hearth in the form of a triangle with sticks of the apāmārga plant.

original: 'bras bu stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight apāmārga fruits.

original: des 'khrul 'khor thams cad ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'khrul 'khor thams cad ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, all the machines will collapse.

original: de nas ra'i pags pa'i ral gu gyon la lag tu mtshon cha thogs te mar me'i mchod sdong ba lang gi rnga ma'i pags pa bcings la /
analyzed: de nas ra'i pags pa'i ral gu gyon la lag tu mtshon cha thogs te mar me'i mchod sdong ba lang gi rnga ma'i pags pa bcings la /
translated: Then, having put on a garment of goat skin, holding a weapon in one's hand, and having bound a lamp wick with the skin of a bull's tail,

original: shal ma li'i dog pas bkang ste dzyo ti smra ta'i 'bru mar la sngags 'dis me sbar ro //
analyzed: shal ma li'i dog pas bkang ste dzyo ti smra ta'i 'bru mar la sngags 'dis me sbar ro //
translated: one should light the fire with the oil of jyotiṣmatī seeds with this mantra:

original: aom d'u bi d'u bi pra dzva li ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom d'u bi d'u bi pra dzva li ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ dūbhi dūbhi prajvālini svāhā.

original: yang na bu ga gang gi rnam par gyur pa de bzhag la snags 'dis me spar te 'khrul khor gyi bla ma bzla'o //
analyzed: yang na bu ga gang gi rnam par gyur pa de bzhag la snags 'dis me spar te 'khrul khor gyi bla ma bzla'o //
translated: Or else, having placed the opening in the form of any [of the above], one should light a fire with this grass and recite the mantra of the guru of the wheel.

original: kun pa mun nag thams cad 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun pa mun nag thams cad 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: All darkness will be destroyed.

original: bdag dang lhan cig spyod pa thams cad sman gyis lus byug go //
analyzed: bdag dang lhan cig spyod pa thams cad sman gyis lus byug go //
translated: One should anoint the body with medicine together with all those who share one's practice.

original: sman ni // 'di dag ste /
analyzed: sman ni // 'di dag ste /
translated: The medicines are these:

original: rgya spos dang / gur gum dang / ru rta dang / spang spos dang / sug smel dang / mu li ka dang / danda autpa la dang / sim ghri dang / bya ghri dang / na ma ska ri dang / aa nanta dang / dza yin ta dang /
analyzed: rgya spos dang / gur gum dang / ru rta dang / spang spos dang / sug smel dang / mu li ka dang / danda autpa la dang / sim ghri dang / bya ghri dang / na ma ska ri dang / aa nanta dang / dza yin ta dang /
translated: sandalwood, saffron, nutmeg, spikenard, turmeric, mulethi, dhanus, utpala, simghina, jaggery, nirama, ananta, jayanti,

original: rma bya'i gtsug phud dag ste /
analyzed: rma bya'i gtsug phud dag ste /
translated: and peacock feathers.

original: 'di rnams kyi phye ma sgyu ma thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi phye ma sgyu ma thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The powder of these is called the destroyer of all illusions.

original: chu'i 'khrul 'khor dang / sbyin dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / bud med kyi dbus su 'jug pa dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo 'gugs pa na cho ga phra mo byas te 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma bzlas nas de'i rkang pa legs par byugs pas spyin la sogs pa'i 'khrul 'khor thams cad 'byung @130b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i 'khrul 'khor dang / sbyin dang / dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / bud med kyi dbus su 'jug pa dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo 'gugs pa na cho ga phra mo byas te 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma bzlas nas de'i rkang pa legs par byugs pas spyin la sogs pa'i 'khrul 'khor thams cad 'byung @130b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The water machine, the gift, the mercury, the elixir, entering into the midst of women, and summoning the daughter of the demigods—having performed the subtle rite, having recited the guru of the machine, having well anointed the foot, all the machines of the gift and so forth will occur.

original: der 'jug pa na sngon du badzra tantu li bklags la ka ra dang lhan cig tu zos la 'jug go /
analyzed: der 'jug pa na sngon du badzra tantu li bklags la ka ra dang lhan cig tu zos la 'jug go /
translated: When entering there, having first recited vajra tantu li, one should enter having eaten together with kara.

original: lha'i khang ba'i lha bshos mi bza'o //
analyzed: lha'i khang ba'i lha bshos mi bza'o //
translated: One should not eat the food of the gods in the temple.

original: lha'i grang la g-yas phyogs nas bskor la 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha'i grang la g-yas phyogs nas bskor la 'gro'o //
translated: One should go around the cold of the gods from the right.

original: rnga'i khang par 'jug go //
analyzed: rnga'i khang par 'jug go //
translated: One should enter the house of the drum.

original: rnga'i 'og tu rul sbal gyi phyag rgya 'bri'o //
analyzed: rnga'i 'og tu rul sbal gyi phyag rgya 'bri'o //
translated: One should draw the mudrā of the tortoise under the drum.

original: dbyug gu la 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la khro bo'i rgyal po bzlos shing brdung ngo //
analyzed: dbyug gu la 'khrul 'khor gyi bla ma brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la khro bo'i rgyal po bzlos shing brdung ngo //
translated: Having recited the guru of the machine one hundred and eight times on the stick, having pressed it down with the left foot, one should beat it while reciting the king of wrathful ones.

original: 'jug pa'i sngon du mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil dang / ;'thor 'thung bzung nas ma 'ongs na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sngon du mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil dang / ;'thor 'thung bzung nas ma 'ongs na /
translated: if they do not come,

original: thams cad der 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad der 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will all die right there.

original: ci nas kyang 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will certainly come.

original: 'di ni / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyis gsungs so //
translated: This was taught by Bhagavān Vajradhara himself.

original: yang na phyag rgya'i steng du rkang pas rkang pa mnan la kha byang du phyogs te phyag rgya bcings la cung zad cig bzla'o //
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya'i steng du rkang pas rkang pa mnan la kha byang du phyogs te phyag rgya bcings la cung zad cig bzla'o //
translated: Or, having pressed one foot with the other foot on top of the mudra, facing north, one should bind the mudra and recite a little.

original: rkang 'og tu nang na gnas pa thams cad dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang 'og tu nang na gnas pa thams cad dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All those who dwell beneath one’s feet, and the daughters of the asuras, will certainly come.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / grub pa'i rdzas rnams ster ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i dngul chu dang / bcud len dang / grub pa'i rdzas rnams ster ro //
translated: They will give whatever is desired, such as the elixir of mercury, the elixir of life, and the substances of accomplishment.

original: de nas ji ltar 'dod pa'i dus de srid du de rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas so //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar 'dod pa'i dus de srid du de rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas so //
translated: Then, for as long as one desires, one will dwell with them.

original: de nas 'ong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas 'ong bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to go there,

original: sems can la phan par byed pa'i rdzas mdzes pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzung la gang 'dod pa de gdon mi za bar 'dong bar bya'o //🔽de nas 'khrul 'khor gyi dbyibs kyi rnam pa sems la bris la lha ma yin gyi phyag @131a *//
analyzed: sems can la phan par byed pa'i rdzas mdzes pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzung la gang 'dod pa de gdon mi za bar 'dong bar bya'o // de nas 'khrul 'khor gyi dbyibs kyi rnam pa sems la bris la lha ma yin gyi phyag @131a *//
translated: One should take whatever beautiful substances are beneficial to sentient beings, and one will certainly go wherever one wishes.

original: rgya'am; gzhan gyi phyag rgya bcings la bzla'o //
analyzed: rgya'am; gzhan gyi phyag rgya bcings la bzla'o //
translated: Then, having drawn the shape of the machine in one’s mind, one should bind the asura mudrā or another mudrā and recite.

original: de'i skad cig la snang ba chen po byung nas sgo grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i skad cig la snang ba chen po byung nas sgo grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that very moment, a great light will appear and the door will open.

original: som nyi med par ji ltar 'dod par 'gro'o; ;dpag tu med pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: som nyi med par ji ltar 'dod par 'gro'o; ;dpag tu med pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without hesitation, one should go wherever one wishes. One will become invincible with immeasurable strength.

original: yid ltar mgyogs pa dang / ji ltar 'dod pa'i rgyal po gdul dka' bar 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ltar mgyogs pa dang / ji ltar 'dod pa'i rgyal po gdul dka' bar 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become as swift as thought, and one will be able to subdue the king of whatever desire realm one wishes.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje rnga bo che sa 'og gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba don yod pa lha ma yin gyi gtso bo skyes bu dpa' bo rnams dbang bskur ba 'di las gzhan pa med do //
analyzed: rdo rje rnga bo che sa 'og gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba don yod pa lha ma yin gyi gtso bo skyes bu dpa' bo rnams dbang bskur ba 'di las gzhan pa med do //
translated: The Vajra Great Drum of the Underworld Mandala is called “the meaningful one,” and there is no other empowerment for the principal asuras, the heroic beings.

original: rdo rje rnga bo che sa 'og gi phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: rdo rje rnga bo che sa 'og gi phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba las /
translated: The Vajra Great Drum of the Underworld Mandala Seal is called “the meaningful one.”

original: don yod pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o ////
analyzed: don yod pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o ////
translated: The sixth chapter on the meaningful one.

original: de nas rdo rje sa 'og las //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sa 'og las //
translated: Then, from the Vajra Underworld,

original: gsungs pa'i dbang bskur rab bshad bya //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i dbang bskur rab bshad bya //
translated: the empowerment that is taught should be explained.

original: sa 'og dkyil 'khor gsang ba yi //
analyzed: sa 'og dkyil 'khor gsang ba yi //
translated: The secret of the underworld mandala

original: rnga yi sgra dbyangs bri bar bya //
analyzed: rnga yi sgra dbyangs bri bar bya //
translated: should be drawn with the sound of a drum.

original: de nas rus sbal phyag rgya gzhag /
analyzed: de nas rus sbal phyag rgya gzhag /
translated: Then, the tortoise seal should be placed🔽on top of white mustard seeds.

original: yungs kar dkar po'i steng du'o; ;mchod pa'i cho ga byas nas su //
analyzed: yungs kar dkar po'i steng du'o; ;mchod pa'i cho ga byas nas su //
translated: Having performed the offering ritual,

original: bra ba'i ras kyi brgyan pa yi //
analyzed: bra ba'i ras kyi brgyan pa yi //
translated: the vase should be adorned with a cloth of raw silk,

original: bum pa rtsa ba mi nag pa //
analyzed: bum pa rtsa ba mi nag pa //
translated: with a black base,

original: rin chen sman gyis yongs bkang la //
analyzed: rin chen sman gyis yongs bkang la //
translated: filled with precious medicine,

original: gtor ma g-yas bskor byin nas su //
analyzed: gtor ma g-yas bskor byin nas su //
translated: and having given the bali clockwise,

original: phyag rgya'i steng du gzhag par bya //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i steng du gzhag par bya //
translated: it should be placed on top of the seal.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i cho ga yis //
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i cho ga yis //
translated: With the ritual as previously explained,

original: dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya //
translated: And consecrate the maṇḍala.

original: lha dang spyan drang byas nas su //
analyzed: lha dang spyan drang byas nas su //
translated: Having invited the deity,

original: ji ltar rigs pa'i mchod pa bya //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa'i mchod pa bya //
translated: One should make offerings as appropriate.

original: @131b bya; ;byang chub sems ni bskyed nas su //
analyzed: @131b bya; ;byang chub sems ni bskyed nas su //
translated: Having generated the thought of awakening,

original: sdig pa yang ni bshags par bya //
analyzed: sdig pa yang ni bshags par bya //
translated: One should confess one’s misdeeds.

original: de nas rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcing //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcing //
translated: Then, having formed the vajra-bond mudrā,

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor phyi rol tu //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor phyi rol tu //
translated: Outside the secret maṇḍala,

original: grub nga'i rdo rje'i chu yis su //
analyzed: grub nga'i rdo rje'i chu yis su //
translated: With the water of the vajra of accomplishment,

original: de nas dbang bskur ba ni bya //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba ni bya //
translated: One should then confer the empowerment.

original: ji lta ba yi dbang bskur la //
analyzed: ji lta ba yi dbang bskur la //
translated: As for the empowerment conferral,

original: de lta bu yi bum pa dgod //🔽gang gi dkyil 'khor cho ga la //
analyzed: de lta bu yi bum pa dgod // gang gi dkyil 'khor cho ga la //
translated: One should arrange the vase in that way.🔽In the ritual of the maṇḍala

original: phyag rgya gtor ma'i cho gar bshad //
analyzed: phyag rgya gtor ma'i cho gar bshad //
translated: Of whatever deity, the mudrā and bali rituals are explained.

original: dbang bskur phyir ni 'bad pa yis //

analyzed: yang na rdo rjes bsnun pa'i shing la 'khor lo byas la dur khrod du ni ma pa'i sol ba la tsha ba'i mar khu dang bsres te sv'ah'a'i yi ge dang ldan pas stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should make a wheel out of wood struck by the vajra, and in a charnel ground, using poisonous charcoal mixed with hot oil, one should offer one thousand and eight oblations with the syllable svāhā.

original: de nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dug dang / khrag dang / yungs kar skya bo bsres te stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs byas pas bu ga'i sgo 'bye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas bu ga'i sgor ba lang gi lci bas dkyil 'khor @144b nye bar byugs la steng du dris byugs te /

analyzed: de nas rdo rje des de'i steng du rdo rje bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas rdo rje de lag pa g-yas par bzung la yungs kar la cung zad cig bsngags te stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs bya'o //

original: ci bde bar rdzas bzung nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci bde bar rdzas bzung nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “He will come, taking whatever substance you desire.

original: de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gzung bar bya'o //

original: gal te mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod na /
translated: If he does not wish to,

original: de rnams dang lhan cig tu 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig tu 'jug par bya'o //
translated: you should enter into union with him.

original: yang na gter 'don par 'dod pas lcags las byas pa'i phur bu bzhi la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te phyogs bzhir btab la gsang sngags bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gter 'don par 'dod pas lcags las byas pa'i phur bu bzhi la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te phyogs bzhir btab la gsang sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: “Or, if you wish to open a treasure, incant four iron daggers twenty-one times and drive them into the four directions. Recite the mantra.

original: de nas der gter 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas der gter 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then a treasure will appear there.

original: 'di ni / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di ni / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal to //

analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya / na ma shtsa nada badzra p'a na ye /

original: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: Lord of the great yakṣa hosts.

original: aom badzre badzre ni /
analyzed: aom badzre badzre ni /
translated: Oṃ vajre vajre,

original: badzro tta re /🔽badzr'a bi dza ye /
analyzed: badzro tta re / badzr'a bi dza ye /

original: badz'a pa ra dzi ti /
analyzed: badz'a pa ra dzi ti /
translated: Vajrāparājitā,🔽Vajrasvāhā.

original: badzra sv'ah'a / li ni h'um phat h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽rdo rjes bsnun pa'i shing la sor brgyad pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa byas te tsandan dmar po las byas pa'i rdo rje'i rnam pa sor bcu drug pa'i stan byas la de'i steng du rdo rje bzhag la gso sbyong dang ldan pas thams cad la tsandan gyi rang
analyzed: badzra sv'ah'a / li ni h'um phat h'um phat sv'a h'a / rdo rjes bsnun pa'i shing la sor brgyad pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa byas te tsandan dmar po las byas pa'i rdo rje'i rnam pa sor bcu drug pa'i stan byas la de'i steng du rdo rje bzhag la gso sbyong dang ldan pas thams cad la tsandan gyi rang
translated: Li ni hūṃ phaṭ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: bzhin du byas te dpal gyi sgor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du byas te dpal gyi sgor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: On a tree struck by lightning, one should make a single-pointed vajra eight finger-breadths long. One should make a seat of the form of a sixteen finger-breadth vajra made of red sandalwood. On top of that, one should place the vajra. Endowed with poṣadha, one should make everything have the nature of sandalwood and place it at the door of glory.

original: lo ma dang / nas zan dang / slong ba za zhing 'bum phrag gsum bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma dang / nas zan dang / slong ba za zhing 'bum phrag gsum bzla bar bya'o //

original: de nas 'khrul 'khor thams cad ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas 'khrul 'khor thams cad ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then all the maṇḍalas will fall.

original: de rnams rang nyid 'ongs nas 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams rang nyid 'ongs nas 'jug par byed do //

original: gal te de rnams ma 'ongs na /🔽las gzhan yang @145a *//
analyzed: gal te de rnams ma 'ongs na / las gzhan yang @145a *//
translated: If they do not come,

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /

original: yungs kar skya bo dang / dug dang / khrag bsres pas stong phrag brgyad bzung la re re la yongs su bzlas te rdo rje la bsnun pas de nas 'ongs te lag nas bzung nas 'jug par byed do //

translated: Having recited the mantra over each oblation, one should strike the vajra.🔽Then they will come and, taking one by the hand, will make one enter.

original: skyes bu dpa' bos las su gyur pa gzhan yang dug dang khrag bsres pas stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs byas pas de nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dpa' bos las su gyur pa gzhan yang dug dang khrag bsres pas stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs byas pas de nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rdo rje bzung la 'jug par bya'o // zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal to //

original: de nas rdo rjes bsnun pa'i shing la mthe bong tsam gyi rdo rje cha shas bcu drug pa rtse mo gsum pa byas te tsandan dmar ba'i khri la rdo rje de gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rjes bsnun pa'i shing la mthe bong tsam gyi rdo rje cha shas bcu drug pa rtse mo gsum pa byas te tsandan dmar ba'i khri la rdo rje de gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, on a tree struck by lightning, one should make a vajra the size of a thumb, with sixteen parts, three points, and one should place that vajra on a throne of red sandalwood.

original: me tog dmar po dag dri la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod de gtor ma byin la nyin mtshan du gso sbyong dang ldan pas k'a ra b'i ra'i me tog gis rdo rje la brgyad brgyar bsnun par bya'o //

translated: Having worshipped with red flowers, scents, and so forth, and given a bali offering, for one day and night, observing the purificatory fast, one should strike the vajra with karavīra flowers eight hundred times.

original: de nas rnam pa gsum 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa gsum 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the three [signs of success] will occur:

analyzed: rdo rje la tsi ti tsi ti 'byung ba dang / bu gar du ba'i sdong bu 'byung ba dang / gzhon nu ma rnams 'ong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe zhugs shig ces smra na /

translated: the maṇḍala should be opened.

original: gang gi tshad du ba 'byung bar mthong na /

original: de nas rang gi khang pa bzhin du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi khang pa bzhin du 'jug par bya'o //

original: gang 'dod pa'i rdzas des ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i rdzas des ster bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas gzhon nu ma rnams 'ong ngo //

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i rdzas rnams ster ro //

analyzed: gzhan du na bud med de rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i srad bus dkyil 'khor gdab par bya'o // rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las /

analyzed: rgyas pa'i le'u ste nyi shu pa'o ////
translated: The chapter on the extensive [ritual].

analyzed: 'og tu rgya mtsho chen po bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de lta bu'i bris sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa gcig pus mi smra ba'am /

analyzed: de nas slob dpon las gnang pa nod de slob dpon la phul du byung ba'i yon phul la sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having received permission from the master, one should offer the master an excellent gift and recite the mantra.

original: de lta bu'i bya ba dang ldan pas sngags bsgrubs pas nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bya ba dang ldan pas sngags bsgrubs pas nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By accomplishing the mantra with such activity, one will certainly succeed.

original: bgegs rnams kyis bar du @149b gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgegs rnams kyis bar du @149b gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Obstructors will not create obstacles.

original: dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs na tshig tsam yang sbyin par mi bya na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs na tshig tsam yang sbyin par mi bya na /
translated: If one has not entered the maṇḍala, one should not even give the mere words,

original: sngags 'grub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: sngags 'grub pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone the accomplishment of the mantra.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa la sngags 'grub pa gsang ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa la sngags 'grub pa gsang ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: One who has such qualities should be taught the secret of the accomplishment of mantras.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / mngon spyod dang / dbang du bya ba dang / gsod pa dang / bskrad pa rnams bsgrub pa'i don du gnas yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / mngon spyod dang / dbang du bya ba dang / gsod pa dang / bskrad pa rnams bsgrub pa'i don du gnas yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should take possession of a place for the sake of accomplishing pacification, enrichment, assault, enthrallment, killing, and banishing.

original: de la re zhig gnas su gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig gnas su gyur pa ni /
translated: Now, first, the place:

original: ri'i rtse mo dang / shing gcig pa dang / dur khrod dang / ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten rnams su bum pa rtsa ba nag po med par nor bu dang / 'bru dang / sman thams cad kyis yongs su bkang la bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du brgyad brgya bzla'o //
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo dang / shing gcig pa dang / dur khrod dang / ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten rnams su bum pa rtsa ba nag po med par nor bu dang / 'bru dang / sman thams cad kyis yongs su bkang la bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du brgyad brgya bzla'o //
translated: On a mountain peak, at a solitary tree, in a charnel ground, or at a stūpa containing relics, one should fill a vase without a black base with jewels, grains, and all medicines, and recite [the mantra] eight hundred times in front of the Blessed One.

original: aom aa mri te h'um phat/
analyzed: aom aa mri te h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ amṛte hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi gnas su sngags 'dis bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi gnas su sngags 'dis bzla bar bya'o //
translated: In the place of the maṇḍala, one should recite this mantra.

original: de nas sa'i phyogs su bum pa la khro bos bsngags te thams cad la bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sa'i phyogs su bum pa la khro bos bsngags te thams cad la bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: Then, in the place, one should sprinkle everywhere with water from the vase, having enchanted it with the mantra of Acala.

original: chu'i rgyun ma chad pas thams cad la bskor ba bya'o //🔽dug dang khrag dang yungs kar bsres pas aarga'i shing la me sbar la stong phrag brgyad bsregs la 'di skad ces kho bos gnas 'di yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: chu'i rgyun ma chad pas thams cad la bskor ba bya'o // dug dang khrag dang yungs kar bsres pas aarga'i shing la me sbar la stong phrag brgyad bsregs la 'di skad ces kho bos gnas 'di yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: By the uninterrupted flow of water, one should circumambulate everything.🔽One should light a fire of argha wood mixed with poison, blood, and white mustard seeds, and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations.

original: zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, “I have taken possession of this place.”

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa de'i rig pa rnams dang / gzhan yang glags lta ba 'jug pa'i go skabs rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa de'i rig pa rnams dang / gzhan yang glags lta ba 'jug pa'i go skabs rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the vidyādharas and others will not find an opportunity to harm him.

original: ji ltar 'dod par sems pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par sems pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish whatever one wishes.

original: cho ga gang sgrub na /
analyzed: cho ga gang sgrub na /
translated: What is the procedure for accomplishing this?

original: @150a *// de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ba lang gi 'o ma dang / nas dang / 'o ma dang // slong ba za zhing de bzhin gshegs pa la phyogs pas 'bum phrag gcig bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: @150a *// de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ba lang gi 'o ma dang / nas dang / 'o ma dang // slong ba za zhing de bzhin gshegs pa la phyogs pas 'bum phrag gcig bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara should eat alms mixed with cow’s milk, barley, and milk, and recite one hundred thousand times, facing the Tathāgata.

original: sngags kyi mthar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi mthar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: At the end of the mantra, one should make a request:

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “When, Blessed One,

original: bdag gi sgrub pa 'di gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur ba de bdag la bka' stsal du gsol zhes brjod la /
analyzed: bdag gi sgrub pa 'di gdon mi za bar 'grub par 'gyur ba de bdag la bka' stsal du gsol zhes brjod la /
translated: Please tell me,  he says, that this practice of mine will certainly be accomplished.

original: de nas rje btsun sangs rgyas kyi mdun du nag po'i brgyad pa'i nyin mtshan gso sbyong dang ldan pas dgong ga'i dus su ji ltar nus pas mchod pa byas te ku sha'i chun po'i steng du bsdad la de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon du phyogs te rig pa
analyzed: de nas rje btsun sangs rgyas kyi mdun du nag po'i brgyad pa'i nyin mtshan gso sbyong dang ldan pas dgong ga'i dus su ji ltar nus pas mchod pa byas te ku sha'i chun po'i steng du bsdad la de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon du phyogs te rig pa
translated: Then, in front of the venerable Buddha, on the eighth day of the dark fortnight, with the poṣadha vow, in the evening, having made offerings to the best of one's ability, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, facing the Tathāgata, one should recite the vidyā

original: khor mor ji srid gnyid ma byung ba de srid bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: khor mor ji srid gnyid ma byung ba de srid bzla bar bya'o //
translated: as much as possible until sleep comes.

original: de nas der ku sha sdom pa la nyal te gnyid kyi mtshan mo thun tshod phyi ma la lha de nyid grub pa yang bka' stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas der ku sha sdom pa la nyal te gnyid kyi mtshan mo thun tshod phyi ma la lha de nyid grub pa yang bka' stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having gone to sleep there, bound by the kuśa grass, in the latter part of the night, that deity will grant the boon of accomplishment.

original: gal te mi gsung na /
analyzed: gal te mi gsung na /
translated: If he does not speak,

original: nyi ma phyi ma la de bzhin du mchod pa'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das spyan dang lhan cig pa mchod de sna ma'i me tog la brgyad brgya yongs su bzlas la phyogs bzhir gtor te ji srid gnyid ma byung ba de srid kyi bar du bzla bar bya'o
analyzed: nyi ma phyi ma la de bzhin du mchod pa'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das spyan dang lhan cig pa mchod de sna ma'i me tog la brgyad brgya yongs su bzlas la phyogs bzhir gtor te ji srid gnyid ma byung ba de srid kyi bar du bzla bar bya'o
translated: In the same way, on the following day, he should worship the Blessed One together with Locanā with the rite of worship, and he should recite the mantra eight hundred times over jasmine flowers and scatter them in the four directions, reciting the mantra as long as he does not fall asleep.

original: // nges par gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // nges par gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will certainly speak.

original: de nas the tshom med par slar yang sngar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du gsang sngags chen mo 'bum phrag gsum dang / stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas the tshom med par slar yang sngar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du gsang sngags chen mo 'bum phrag gsum dang / stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, without any doubt, he should again recite the great queen of incantations three hundred thousand times and eight thousand times, according to the rite explained previously.

original: de @150b nas sbyin sreg gi cho ga ni /
analyzed: de @150b nas sbyin sreg gi cho ga ni /
translated: Next, the rite of burnt offerings:

original: mngon spyod la stegs bu gru gsum pa bya'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod la stegs bu gru gsum pa bya'o //
translated: For the rite of assault, the hearth should be triangular.

original: rgyas pa la gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la gru bzhi'o //
translated: For prosperity, it should be square.

original: zhi ba la zlum pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la zlum pa'o //
translated: For pacification, it should be round.

original: sgrub pa chen po la padma'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po la padma'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For the great rite, it should be in the form of a lotus.

original: dbang du bya ba la lcags kyu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba la lcags kyu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For enthrallment, it should be in the form of a goad.

original: rig pa dang lhan cig tu dri zhim po'i me tog dang / yam shing bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang lhan cig tu dri zhim po'i me tog dang / yam shing bsreg par bya'o //
translated: He should offer fragrant flowers and sticks into the fire together with the knowledge [mantra].

original: mngon spyod la dur khrod kyi shing la tsha ba gsum dang / skye tshe dang / yungs kar dang / lan tshva dang / thal ba dang khrag la sogs pas khro bo la sreg blugs bya'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod la dur khrod kyi shing la tsha ba gsum dang / skye tshe dang / yungs kar dang / lan tshva dang / thal ba dang khrag la sogs pas khro bo la sreg blugs bya'o //
translated: In the case of violent action, one should make a burnt offering to the wrathful deity with wood from a charnel ground, the three pungent roots, nitre, white mustard seed, salt, ashes, blood, and so forth.

original: zhi ba la sman gyi ljon pa'i yam shing gis so //
analyzed: zhi ba la sman gyi ljon pa'i yam shing gis so //
translated: In the case of pacification, one should use the wood of a medicinal tree.

original: rgyas pa la 'o ma can gyi yam shing gis so //
analyzed: rgyas pa la 'o ma can gyi yam shing gis so //
translated: In the case of prosperity, one should use the wood of a tree that exudes milky sap.

original: zhi ba la me tog dang dri dkar pos so //
analyzed: zhi ba la me tog dang dri dkar pos so //
translated: In the case of pacification, one should use white flowers and perfumes.

original: rgyas pa la me tog dang dri ser pos so //
analyzed: rgyas pa la me tog dang dri ser pos so //
translated: In the case of prosperity, one should use yellow flowers and perfumes.

original: mngon spyod la me tog dang dri dmar pos so //
analyzed: mngon spyod la me tog dang dri dmar pos so //
translated: In the case of violent action, one should use red flowers and perfumes.

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba dang ldan pa'i sngags kyis thun gsum du las bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba dang ldan pa'i sngags kyis thun gsum du las bya'o //
translated: One should perform the rites three times a day with a mantra that includes homage to the Three Jewels.

original: sgrub pa chen po la dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba dang ldan pas las bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po la dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba dang ldan pas las bya'o //
translated: In the case of a great rite, one should perform the rite with homage to the Three Jewels.

original: zhi ba la skyil krung gis so //🔽rgyas pa la tsog pus so //
analyzed: zhi ba la skyil krung gis so // rgyas pa la tsog pus so //
translated: In the case of pacification, one should sit cross-legged.🔽In the case of prosperity, one should sit with one’s knees drawn up to one’s chest.

original: mngon spyod la rkang pas rkang pa mnan pas so //
analyzed: mngon spyod la rkang pas rkang pa mnan pas so //
translated: In the case of violent action, one should press one foot with the other.

original: zas mi za bar sreg blugs bya'o //
analyzed: zas mi za bar sreg blugs bya'o //
translated: One should make the burnt offering without eating food.

original: sgrub pa chen po dang / zhi ba la h'um gi yi ge bzla'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po dang / zhi ba la h'um gi yi ge bzla'o //
translated: In the great accomplishment and in the pacifying, one should recite the syllable hūṃ.

original: mngon spyod la phat kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod la phat kyi yi ge'o //
translated: In the violent, the syllable phaṭ.

original: zhi ba la srod kyi thun la'o; ;rgyas pa la snga dro'i thun la'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la srod kyi thun la'o; ;rgyas pa la snga dro'i thun la'o //
translated: In the pacifying, during the first watch of the night; in the prospering, during the morning watch;

original: mngon spyod la nyi ma gung ngam nam gung gi dus su kha lhor bltas te las bya'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod la nyi ma gung ngam nam gung gi dus su kha lhor bltas te las bya'o //
translated: in the violent, at noon or midnight, facing south, one should perform the rite.

original: sgrub pa chen po dang zhi ba la kha shar du phyogs pas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po dang zhi ba la kha shar du phyogs pas so //
translated: In the great accomplishment and in the pacifying, facing east;

original: @151a *// rgyas pa la byang du phyogs pas so //
analyzed: @151a *// rgyas pa la byang du phyogs pas so //
translated: in the prospering, facing north;

original: dbang du bya ba la byang du phyogs pas so //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba la byang du phyogs pas so //
translated: in the summoning, facing north.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar lha la mchod pa byas te rgyas pa'i las bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar lha la mchod pa byas te rgyas pa'i las bya'o //
translated: In the presence of the Blessed Buddha, having worshipped the gods, one should perform the prospering rite.

original: dur khrod dang / rtags gcig par dbang du bya ba la mngon spyod do //
analyzed: dur khrod dang / rtags gcig par dbang du bya ba la mngon spyod do //
translated: In the summoning, in a charnel ground or a lonely place; in the violent, in a charnel ground.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa la me spar te bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa la me spar te bya'o //
translated: In the pacifying, etc., one should perform the rite after kindling a fire.

original: gang gi tshe der me bzang por gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe der me bzang por gyur na /
translated: When the fire becomes good,

original: de nas las 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas las 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the rite will be accomplished.

original: thog ma kho nar sngags kyis lha spyan drangs te phyis bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar sngags kyis lha spyan drangs te phyis bcing bar bya'o //
translated: First, one should invoke the deity with the mantra, and then bind him.

original: thog mar de ltar ma byas na /
analyzed: thog mar de ltar ma byas na /
translated: If one does not do it in this way at the outset,

original: rig pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one will not accomplish the knowledge.

original: spyan drangs nas dri'i chus gang pa'i snod du me tog dkar po dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyogs te gsang sngags brgyad brgya bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs nas dri'i chus gang pa'i snod du me tog dkar po dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyogs te gsang sngags brgyad brgya bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: After invoking him, one should recite the mantra eight hundred times in front of the Blessed Buddha, with white flowers in a vessel filled with perfumed water.

original: sgrub pa chen po 'byung ba'i mtshan ma rnams 'byung ste /🔽glo bur du dung gi sgra'am /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po 'byung ba'i mtshan ma rnams 'byung ste / glo bur du dung gi sgra'am /
translated: The signs of the occurrence of the great accomplishment will appear.

original: 'brug gi sgra thos pa dang / dri zhim po byung na /
analyzed: 'brug gi sgra thos pa dang / dri zhim po byung na /
translated: If one suddenly hears the sound of a conch or the sound of thunder, and a sweet fragrance arises,

original: de nas rig pa'i lha 'ongs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa'i lha 'ongs par shes par bya'o //
translated: then one should know that the knowledge deity has come.

original: gal te ma 'ongs na /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs na /
translated: If he does not come,

original: bcom ldan 'das spyan dang lhan cig pa la sngar bzhin du mchod yon bzung ste brgyad brgya bzla'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das spyan dang lhan cig pa la sngar bzhin du mchod yon bzung ste brgyad brgya bzla'o //
translated: one should offer him water for the feet, as before, together with the Blessed One, and recite the mantra eight hundred times.

original: 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will come.

original: byon pa dang / dkyil 'khor bcing ba dang / phyogs bcings la gtor ma dang / lha bshos dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: byon pa dang / dkyil 'khor bcing ba dang / phyogs bcings la gtor ma dang / lha bshos dbul bar bya'o //
translated: and having arrived, he should bind the maṇḍala, bind the directions, offer the bali, and offer the oblations.

original: de nas mig sman dang / ldong ros la sogs pa rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mig sman dang / ldong ros la sogs pa rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then he should accomplish the eye medicine, collyrium, and so forth.

original: sngon @151b du sbyangs te phyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon @151b du sbyangs te phyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having previously trained, he should later accomplish [the practice].

original: mig sman dang / ldong ros la sogs pa rnams la nyin mtshan du 'o mas bran zhing gzhag go /
analyzed: mig sman dang / ldong ros la sogs pa rnams la nyin mtshan du 'o mas bran zhing gzhag go /
translated: He should smear the eye medicine, collyrium, and so forth with milk day and night.

original: de nas bton la ji ltar nus pas dge 'dun la dga' ston bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bton la ji ltar nus pas dge 'dun la dga' ston bya'o //
translated: Then, having extracted [the medicine], he should offer a feast to the saṅgha according to his ability.

original: skar ma rgyal la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mchod pas mchod la ras dkar po ma nyams pas g-yogs te bsod nams mchod la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: skar ma rgyal la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mchod pas mchod la ras dkar po ma nyams pas g-yogs te bsod nams mchod la brtag par bya'o //
translated: Under the constellation Puṣya, having made offerings in front of the Blessed Buddha, he should cover [the medicine] with a new white cloth and examine it for auspiciousness.

original: brtags pa na sngon gyi mtshan ma byung na /
analyzed: brtags pa na sngon gyi mtshan ma byung na /
translated: If the previous signs occur,

original: las 'grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las 'grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: he should know that the rite will be accomplished.

original: mtshan ma gzhan yang sil snyan gyi sgra dang / dung gi sgra dang / rgyal ba'i sgra byung na /
analyzed: mtshan ma gzhan yang sil snyan gyi sgra dang / dung gi sgra dang / rgyal ba'i sgra byung na /
translated: If other signs occur, such as the sound of musical instruments, the sound of conches, and the sound of victory,

original: sil snyan gyi sgras rig pa 'dzin pa chen po 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽rgyal ba'i sgras mkha' la 'gro ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sil snyan gyi sgras rig pa 'dzin pa chen po 'grub par 'gyur ro // rgyal ba'i sgras mkha' la 'gro ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the sound of cymbals, one will accomplish the state of a great vidyādhara.🔽By the sound of a conch, one will accomplish the state of a sky-faring being.

original: dung gi sgras dbang du byed pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dung gi sgras dbang du byed pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the sound of a drum, one will accomplish the state of a vidyādhara.

original: rdzas btags te ming med kyis ril bu lnga bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas btags te ming med kyis ril bu lnga bya'o //
translated: One should prepare five pills with the substances and the nameless one.

original: ras ma nyams pa'i steng du bzhag ste grib ma la bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: ras ma nyams pa'i steng du bzhag ste grib ma la bskam par bya'o //
translated: One should place them on a piece of undamaged cloth and dry them in the shade.

original: de nas aa shvattha'i shing gi steng du bzhag nas zhag bdun du lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aa shvattha'i shing gi steng du bzhag nas zhag bdun du lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should place them on an aśvattha tree and perform the consecration for seven days.

original: de nas thog ma sgrub pa'i nyin mo snga dro'i tshe yongs su lhung bas bsnun pa la lan stong phrag gcig bsngags te /
analyzed: de nas thog ma sgrub pa'i nyin mo snga dro'i tshe yongs su lhung bas bsnun pa la lan stong phrag gcig bsngags te /
translated: Then, on the first day of the practice, in the morning, one should anoint the pills with the five nectars and incant them one thousand times.

original: de nas phye ma red sgrub pa la 'jug par bya ste; aa shvattha'i lo ma bzhi g-yas bskor du bskor ba la bzhag ste gsum gyis dgab bo //
analyzed: de nas phye ma red sgrub pa la 'jug par bya ste; aa shvattha'i lo ma bzhi g-yas bskor du bskor ba la bzhag ste gsum gyis dgab bo //
translated: Then, one should begin the practice at dusk, placing the pills on four aśvattha leaves arranged in a clockwise circle and covering them with three more leaves.

original: aa shvattha'i lo ma rnams 'di lta bu'i gnas nas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: aa shvattha'i lo ma rnams 'di lta bu'i gnas nas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The aśvattha leaves should be taken from such a place.

original: ljon shing gzhan @152a *//
analyzed: ljon shing gzhan @152a *//
translated: One should not take leaves of the aśvattha tree that are not shaded by the foliage of other trees,

original: gyi grib mas ma phog pa dang / lha'i khang pas ma phog pa dang / dur khrod du skyes pa rnams kyi aa shvattha'i lo ma yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gyi grib mas ma phog pa dang / lha'i khang pas ma phog pa dang / dur khrod du skyes pa rnams kyi aa shvattha'i lo ma yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: that are not shaded by divine palaces, or that are growing in a charnel ground.

original: de dag las gzhan gnas bsngags pa'i aa shvattha'i shing gi lo ma rtse mo dkar po rnams kyi steng du grub pa'i rdzas cha gsum du byas te bla ma dang / bdag nyid dang / lhan cig pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan gnas bsngags pa'i aa shvattha'i shing gi lo ma rtse mo dkar po rnams kyi steng du grub pa'i rdzas cha gsum du byas te bla ma dang / bdag nyid dang / lhan cig pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: One should take the leaves of the aśvattha tree that are praised as the abode of accomplishment, which are white at the tip, and divide the substances of accomplishment into three parts: for the guru, for oneself, and for the companions.

original: rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / ral gri rnams su blos brtags nas de dag thun tshod lngar yongs su bskams te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / ral gri rnams su blos brtags nas de dag thun tshod lngar yongs su bskams te /
translated: Having mentally designated them as a vajra, wheel, and sword, respectively, one should dry them in the shade for five watches.

original: de nas pa lang gi lci ba'i tshogs kyi dbus su bcug la zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu gzhag go /
analyzed: de nas pa lang gi lci ba'i tshogs kyi dbus su bcug la zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu gzhag go /
translated: Then, having placed them in the middle of a heap of cow dung, one should leave them there for twenty-one days.

original: de nas bton te ba'i rnam lngas bkrus la de nyid du zhag bdun lhag par gnas par byas te yongs su ltung bas bsnun pa la stong phrag brgyad yongs su bzlas la /
analyzed: de nas bton te ba'i rnam lngas bkrus la de nyid du zhag bdun lhag par gnas par byas te yongs su ltung bas bsnun pa la stong phrag brgyad yongs su bzlas la /
translated: Then, having struck it with a stick of cutch wood, enchant it one thousand and eight times with the mantra of the Blessed One.

original: de nas sgrub pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa la 'jug go /
translated: Then, one should commence the rite.

original: mig sman de dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / lo dra rnams bsres la bcom ldan 'das spyan ma'i snying po stong phrag brgyad mngon par bsngags te /
analyzed: mig sman de dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / lo dra rnams bsres la bcom ldan 'das spyan ma'i snying po stong phrag brgyad mngon par bsngags te /
translated: Having mixed together eye medicine, costus root, camphor, and costus, enchant the essence of the Blessed One, Locanā, one thousand and eight times.

original: sgrub pa'i dus su mig la byugs pas gnyid mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus su mig la byugs pas gnyid mi 'byung ngo //
translated: At the time of the rite, having applied it to the eyes, one will not fall asleep.

original: gzhan yang sman du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sman du gyur pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the medicine is as follows:

original: aa ba marga dkar po'i rtsa ba dang / shu dag skya bo dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / gi wang dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dkar po dang / thog mar ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten gyi mdun du zhag gsum du smyung ba byas te rda @152b rje go cha'i sngags stong phrag brgyad mngon par bsngags so //
analyzed: aa ba marga dkar po'i rtsa ba dang / shu dag skya bo dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / gi wang dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dkar po dang / thog mar ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten gyi mdun du zhag gsum du smyung ba byas te rda @152b rje go cha'i sngags stong phrag brgyad mngon par bsngags so //
translated: and first, in front of a stūpa containing relics, having fasted for three days, one should incant the armor mantra eight thousand times.

original: de nas sgrub pa'i dus su ba lang gi gcin dang btags te lus la yongs su bskus nas sgrub pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa'i dus su ba lang gi gcin dang btags te lus la yongs su bskus nas sgrub pa la 'jug go /
translated: Then, at the time of practice, having mixed it with cow's urine and anointed one's body, one should engage in the practice.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / rig pa 'dzin pa dang / log 'dren thams cad kyis rgyang nas 'od dang ldan pa'i me'i phung po ltar 'bar bar mthong ste /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / rig pa 'dzin pa dang / log 'dren thams cad kyis rgyang nas 'od dang ldan pa'i me'i phung po ltar 'bar bar mthong ste /
translated: All gods, nāgas, yakṣas, vidyādharas, and evil spirits will see it from afar, blazing like a mass of fire with light.

original: mthong nas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong nas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen it, they will pay homage.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi rigs rnams mtshungs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi rigs rnams mtshungs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All mundane and supramundane families will be accomplished equally.

original: gang gi tshe rig pa 'dzin pas rdzas grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig pa 'dzin pas rdzas grub par gyur na /
translated: When the knowledge-mantra bearer has become substantial,

original: de nas sngon bzhin bcom ldan 'das spyan ma'i sngags kyis me tog dkar po la brgyad brgya bzlas la rdzas kyi dbus su bcug pas rdzas brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sngon bzhin bcom ldan 'das spyan ma'i sngags kyis me tog dkar po la brgyad brgya bzlas la rdzas kyi dbus su bcug pas rdzas brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, as before, with the mantra of Bhagavatī Locanā, he should enchant a white flower one hundred and eight times and insert it in the middle of the substance. The substance will become stable.

original: gzhan du na dngos grub 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos grub 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the power will be taken away.

original: gal te rig pa 'dzin pas gsang sngags grub par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rig pa 'dzin pas gsang sngags grub par ma gyur na /
translated: If the knowledge-mantra bearer has not become accomplished,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa des 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa des 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: then the knowledge-mantra bearer should do this:

original: rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa'i chu bo'i 'gram du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i snying po can gyi mchod rten khru gang ba brgyad brgya byas la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa'i chu bo'i 'gram du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i snying po can gyi mchod rten khru gang ba brgyad brgya byas la /
translated: On the bank of a river that flows into the great ocean, he should make eight hundred caityas, each one cubit high, and containing the essence of dependent origination.

original: mchod rten re re la ji ltar nus pa'i dri dang / me tog dang / bdug spos phul te dus gsum du byang chub kyi sems bskyed la sdig pa bshags te re re'i mdun du stong phrag brgyad dam /
analyzed: mchod rten re re la ji ltar nus pa'i dri dang / me tog dang / bdug spos phul te dus gsum du byang chub kyi sems bskyed la sdig pa bshags te re re'i mdun du stong phrag brgyad dam /
translated: He should offer to each caitya as much perfume, flowers, and incense as he can afford. Three times a day he should generate the thought of awakening, confess his sins, and recite the mantra eight thousand or

original: brgyad brgya bzla'o //
analyzed: brgyad brgya bzla'o //
translated: eight hundred times in front of each caitya.

original: gal te mtshan ma ma byung na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma ma byung na /
translated: If there are no signs,

original: cho ga 'dis mchod rten stong phrag gcig byas te /
analyzed: cho ga 'dis mchod rten stong phrag gcig byas te /
translated: one should make one thousand caityas according to this rite.

original: de'i nub @153a *//
analyzed: de'i nub @153a *//
translated: In the evening,

original: phyogs ma yin pa'i mchod rten 'bar na /
analyzed: phyogs ma yin pa'i mchod rten 'bar na /
translated: if the caitya blazes without being in the west,

original: las kyi sgrib pa zad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa zad par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know that karmic obscurations have been exhausted.

original: de nas gang ci sgrub pa de thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gang ci sgrub pa de thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, whatever one accomplishes will all be accomplished.

original: sgrub pa chen po brtsams nas las gzhan dbab pa dang / gsod pa la sogs pa rnams mi bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po brtsams nas las gzhan dbab pa dang / gsod pa la sogs pa rnams mi bya'o //
translated: Having begun the great accomplishment, one should not perform other actions such as bringing down and killing.

original: gal te byas na /
analyzed: gal te byas na /
translated: If one does so,

original: rig pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the vidyā will not be accomplished.

original: long ba dang / sgur bo dang / rlig rlugs dang / 'on pa dang / sen mo ngan pa dang / sha bkra can dang / lus zha ba dang / spo nag pa rnams kyis sgrub pa chen po 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: long ba dang / sgur bo dang / rlig rlugs dang / 'on pa dang / sen mo ngan pa dang / sha bkra can dang / lus zha ba dang / spo nag pa rnams kyis sgrub pa chen po 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The blind, the hunchbacked, the impotent, the deaf, those with bad nails, those with vitiligo, those with crippled bodies, and those with dark moles will not accomplish the great accomplishment.

original: gzhan gza' la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gza' la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Others will accomplish the planets and so forth.

original: mi gang sangs rgyas dang chos la dad pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dun pa dang ldan pa dang / sen mo zangs kyi mdog can dang ldan pa dang / pha ma la gus pa dang / bla ma la sri zhu che ba des thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gang sangs rgyas dang chos la dad pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dun pa dang ldan pa dang / sen mo zangs kyi mdog can dang ldan pa dang / pha ma la gus pa dang / bla ma la sri zhu che ba des thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever has faith in the Buddha and the Dharma, has aspiration, has copper-colored nails, is respectful to their parents, and is very helpful to their gurus, will accomplish everything.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas sngags sgrub pa sngon bzhin sgrub pa dang ldan na /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas sngags sgrub pa sngon bzhin sgrub pa dang ldan na /
translated: If a knowledge-holder, as before, practices with the accomplishment of mantra,

original: tshe'i dus byas kyang gang 'dod pa sems shing shibs /
analyzed: tshe'i dus byas kyang gang 'dod pa sems shing shibs /
translated: even if they die, they will be born wherever they wish, thinking and longing for it.

original: de shi ba tsam gyis de dang der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de shi ba tsam gyis de dang der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just by dying, they will be born there.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor los bsgyur ba chen po'am /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor los bsgyur ba chen po'am /
translated: They will be a great wheel-turning knowledge-holder,

original: yang na rig pa 'dzin pa'i rigs sam /
analyzed: yang na rig pa 'dzin pa'i rigs sam /
translated: or they will be born in a family of knowledge-holders,

original: dbang phyug chen po'i rigs sam /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i rigs sam /
translated: or in a family of Maheśvara,🔽or in a family of Cāṇḍāla.

original: gdol pa'i rigs 'dzin pa'i rigs de lta bu'i rim pa gang 'dod pa'i bsam pas sngags bsgrubs pas de lta bu'i rigs su 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdol pa'i rigs 'dzin pa'i rigs de lta bu'i rim pa gang 'dod pa'i bsam pas sngags bsgrubs pas de lta bu'i rigs su 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By accomplishing mantra with the aspiration for such a family, they will accomplish such a family.

original: sgrub @153b pa chen po la 'bad pa'i rig pa 'dzin pas rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / rtse gsum dang / dbyug gu dang / zhags pa dang / mdung thung dang / dbyug tho dang / padma dang / dung dang / lcags kyu dang /
analyzed: sgrub @153b pa chen po la 'bad pa'i rig pa 'dzin pas rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / rtse gsum dang / dbyug gu dang / zhags pa dang / mdung thung dang / dbyug tho dang / padma dang / dung dang / lcags kyu dang /
translated: The vidyādhara who strives in the great practice should not step over the vajra, wheel, trident, mace, noose, javelin, club, lotus, conch, iron hook,

original: spyi blugs la sogs pa rnams la rkang pas brdzi bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi blugs la sogs pa rnams la rkang pas brdzi bar mi bya'o //
translated: water pot, and so on.

original: sa la bris pa yang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: sa la bris pa yang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The same should be done with those drawn on the ground.

original: 'di ltar rdo rje 'chang ba'i rdo rje dang / khyab 'jug gi 'khor lo dang / lha chen po'i rtsa gsum dang / gshin rje'i dbyug gu dang / chu lha'i zhags pa dang / gzhon nu'i mdung thung dang / stobs lha'i dbyug tho dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi padma dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje 'chang ba'i rdo rje dang / khyab 'jug gi 'khor lo dang / lha chen po'i rtsa gsum dang / gshin rje'i dbyug gu dang / chu lha'i zhags pa dang / gzhon nu'i mdung thung dang / stobs lha'i dbyug tho dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi padma dang /
translated: Thus, the vajra of Vajradhara, the wheel of Viṣṇu, the trident of Maheśvara, the mace of Yama, the noose of Varuṇa, the javelin of Kumāra, the club of Vāsudeva, the lotus of the bodhisattvas,

original: rdo rje lcags kyu'i lcags kyu dang / tshangs pa'i spyi blugs te /
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu'i lcags kyu dang / tshangs pa'i spyi blugs te /
translated: the iron hook of the vajra hook, and the water pot of Brahmā🔽are not to be stepped over.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub gang thob par 'dod pas bdag nyid kyis rdo rje la sogs pa de dang de dag phyag rgya chen po'i rkang pas brdzi bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub gang thob par 'dod pas bdag nyid kyis rdo rje la sogs pa de dang de dag phyag rgya chen po'i rkang pas brdzi bar mi bya'o //
translated: Whoever wishes to attain the spiritual powers of the great seal should not step over the vajra and so forth with the feet of the great seal.

original: gang gi tshe rig pa 'dzin pa'i gsang sngags bsgrubs pa na rig pa'i lha dngos grub mi ster na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig pa 'dzin pa'i gsang sngags bsgrubs pa na rig pa'i lha dngos grub mi ster na /
translated: When one is practicing the mantra of the awareness holder and the deity of awareness does not grant spiritual powers,

original: des las 'dis rig pa mnyes par bya ste; dri thams cad kyis rig pa'i lha'i gzugs brnyan byas la /
analyzed: des las 'dis rig pa mnyes par bya ste; dri thams cad kyis rig pa'i lha'i gzugs brnyan byas la /
translated: one should please the awareness deity with this rite: Make an image of the awareness deity out of all the fragrant substances,

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi drung du bzhag ste zhag gsum du myung bar gnas la nag po'i brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi drung du bzhag ste zhag gsum du myung bar gnas la nag po'i brgyad pa'am /
translated: place it in front of the feet of Lord Vajrapāṇi, and fast for three days.🔽On the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight,

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi la spyan dang lhan cig pa'i rig sngags kyis sna ma'i me tog stong phrag brgyad de'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar brdeg par bya zhing /🔽mar nag dang mar @154a *//
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi la spyan dang lhan cig pa'i rig sngags kyis sna ma'i me tog stong phrag brgyad de'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar brdeg par bya zhing / mar nag dang mar @154a *//
translated: with the awareness mantra of the eye, strike the heart of the image with eight thousand jasmine flowers,

original: bsres pas stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs byas la /
analyzed: bsres pas stong phrag brgyad sreg blugs byas la /
translated: and make eight thousand burnt offerings of sesame oil and🔽sesame seeds.

original: de nyid du 'khod de ji ltar nus pa'i mchod pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid du 'khod de ji ltar nus pa'i mchod pa dang / gtor ma'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: Having settled down right there, one should make offerings and a bali offering ritual to the best of one’s ability.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa de rangs pas gnyid log pa dang / ston par 'gyur ba'am /🔽rjes su gdams pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa de rangs pas gnyid log pa dang / ston par 'gyur ba'am / rjes su gdams pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara, being pleased, will fall asleep, and will teach or instruct.

original: gal te ma 'ongs na /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs na /
translated: If he does not come,

original: nyi ma phyi ma la de bzhin du gtor ma'i cho ga byas te rdo rje khro bo dang lhan cig tu stong phrag brgyad bzla'o //
analyzed: nyi ma phyi ma la de bzhin du gtor ma'i cho ga byas te rdo rje khro bo dang lhan cig tu stong phrag brgyad bzla'o //
translated: on the following day one should make a bali offering ritual as before, and recite the mantra of Vajrakrodha one thousand and eight times.

original: de nas rig pa'i lha de nyid khro bo dang lhan cig tu rmi lam du mthong nas chad pa dang / lhag pa dang / phyi mo dman pa dang / yi ge gzhan du gyur pa yang stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa'i lha de nyid khro bo dang lhan cig tu rmi lam du mthong nas chad pa dang / lhag pa dang / phyi mo dman pa dang / yi ge gzhan du gyur pa yang stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the deity of the vidyā, together with Krodha, will be seen in a dream, and the omissions, additions, and errors in the recitation will be corrected.

original: gal te yongs su rdzogs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su rdzogs par gyur na /
translated: If it is completely finished,

original: de nas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he will grant spiritual powers.

original: sgrub pa dang po la las 'di mi bya la ji srid lan bdun bsgrubs kyang ma grub na /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang po la las 'di mi bya la ji srid lan bdun bsgrubs kyang ma grub na /
translated: This rite should not be performed in the first practice. If one does not accomplish it even after seven repetitions,

original: de nas las 'di bya'o //
analyzed: de nas las 'di bya'o //
translated: then one should perform this rite.

original: de nas rdzas sgrub pa'i dus su gyur na /
analyzed: de nas rdzas sgrub pa'i dus su gyur na /
translated: Then, when the time comes for the accomplishment of the substance,

original: de'i mthar srod dam /
analyzed: de'i mthar srod dam /
translated: at the end of that, in the evening,

original: nam gung dang / nyi ma shar ba na rig pa 'dzin pas rmi lam lta bur gsang sngags gang 'dod pa yid la sems shing bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam gung dang / nyi ma shar ba na rig pa 'dzin pas rmi lam lta bur gsang sngags gang 'dod pa yid la sems shing bzla bar bya'o //
translated: at midnight, or at sunrise, the knowledge-holder should think in his mind and recite the mantra as desired, like a dream.

original: gzhan du na log par 'dren pa rnams zhugs par gyur nas rig pa'i lha mngon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na log par 'dren pa rnams zhugs par gyur nas rig pa'i lha mngon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the wrong ones enter, the knowledge deity will not manifest.

original: gzhan gyi gos la reg par mi bya zhing bgo ba gsum byas te gcig gyon la khrus bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gos la reg par mi bya zhing bgo ba gsum byas te gcig gyon la khrus bya'o //
translated: One should not touch another's clothes, but wear three garments, and bathe wearing one.

original: gnyis pas bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas bzla bar bya'o //
translated: With the second, one should recite.

original: gsum @154b pas mtshan mo gyon par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum @154b pas mtshan mo gyon par bya'o //
translated: With the third, one should sleep at night.

original: skyil krung gis gnas te rig pa'i lha'i mtshan ma mthong nas til dang / mar bsres pa'i sreg blugs bya'o //
analyzed: skyil krung gis gnas te rig pa'i lha'i mtshan ma mthong nas til dang / mar bsres pa'i sreg blugs bya'o //
translated: Seated cross-legged, having seen the sign of the knowledge deity, one should offer oblations of sesame and clarified butter mixed.

original: rig pa'i stobs 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i stobs 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The power of the knowledge will increase.

original: til med na /
analyzed: til med na /
translated: If there is no sesame,

original: dantu la dang / sran ma ma sha dang / mud ga rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: dantu la dang / sran ma ma sha dang / mud ga rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: one should use dantūra, beans, and mung beans.

original: nya dang sha dang / chang btung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: nya dang sha dang / chang btung bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not eat fish, meat, or drink alcohol.

original: nyes pa des log par 'dren pa rnams kyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa des log par 'dren pa rnams kyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that fault, one will be overcome by those who lead astray.🔽One should always generate the great thought of awakening, endowed with reverence for the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: rtag tu sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur ba dang ldan pas byang chub kyi sems chen po bskyed par bya'o; ;dam tshig shes par gyur pas 'di ltar byas na /
analyzed: rtag tu sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur ba dang ldan pas byang chub kyi sems chen po bskyed par bya'o; ;dam tshig shes par gyur pas 'di ltar byas na /
translated: If one acts in this way, knowing the commitments,

original: ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will soon be successful.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas sngar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas sngar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should do as was previously explained.

analyzed: rtag tu lha thams cad la bdug dang / lha bshos kyi 'bras chen rang gi lag gis dbul bar bya'o //
